commit_message:
Fix endless periodic looping call after failed evacuation

Fixes an issue where a failed evacuation could result in a periodic
looping call to run forever. This happened because the periodic call was
not stopped after a timeout occurred.

Change-Id: Id3b9bad4bc617c168200d34d69bbe760a24dfcf9
Closes-Bug: #1897888
(cherry picked from commit df63714b03cef5906791f14bbf2416beab23ca0a)

commit_message:
Fix endless periodic looping call after failed evacuation

Fixes an issue where a failed evacuation could result in a periodic
looping call to run forever. This happened because the periodic call was
not stopped after a timeout occurred.

Change-Id: Id3b9bad4bc617c168200d34d69bbe760a24dfcf9
Closes-Bug: #1897888
(cherry picked from commit df63714b03cef5906791f14bbf2416beab23ca0a)

commit_message:
Rebuild to pickup c-h fix for local_address()

The charm-helpers fix [1] ensures that the new local_address function in
charm-helpers works with pre-2.8 Juju.  This rebuild is to pick that
change for the 21.01 charm freeze testing period.

[1]: https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/562

Change-Id: I36397564b538524934b9c59ad88818182f0e72a0

messages:
[{'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-15 16:08:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-18 15:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

test_launch_small_instance failed on bionic-train. Might be a one-time thing'}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-18 15:37:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The test failed due to this in the nova-cloud-controller log:

nova-conductor.log:6911:2021-01-15 22:38:01.774 9535 ERROR nova.conductor.manager [req-b89360b6-150b-4ae0-bda4-860971449d52 d3e00e5467474d968ed0731677415b28 e2501fa544b14d24ad7318aae22e1b18 - e2b24acc0c5b42c682e9115815b8eb5d e2b24acc0c5b42c682e91158
15b8eb5d] Failed to schedule instances: nova.exception_Remote.NoValidHost_Remote: No valid host was found. There are not enough hosts available.

The nova-log is full of these SSL errors:

2021-01-15 22:48:25.345 1875 ERROR nova keystoneauth1.exceptions.connection.SSLError: SSL exception connecting to https://172.17.103.13:35357: HTTPSConnectionPool(host='172.17.103.13', port=35357): Max retries exceeded with url: / (Caused by SSLError(SSLError(1, '[SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED] certificate verify failed (_ssl.c:852)'),))

Which probably means that the new-ish cert features in charm-helpers have broken it in some way."}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-18 15:44:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Several nova-* reviews from this topic haven't landed, so probably the latest cert-related fixes haven't made their way into these charms yet."}, {'account_id': 20870, 'date': '2021-01-18 18:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

charm-recheck-full'}, {'account_id': 31289, 'date': '2021-01-19 09:14:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-17 02:27:25.000000000', 'message': 'Fix removal of dvr-src mac flows when non-gateway port on router is deleted

Removal of non-gateway port on DVR router deletes all the DVR to
SRC mac flows for the instances of same subnet on that compute node.
The instances are not reachable from any other network.

This patch checks if the DVR router port is gateway for the subnet
or not. And deletes the DVR-SRC mac flows only if it is gateway port.
The DVR-SRC mac flows are deleted if the gateway is not set for the subnet.

Change-Id: Iadc1671c862f8c01e5761e92b82a04849d4bb411
Closes-Bug: #1892405
(cherry picked from commit 329ea19f8b881421b9b5ae2fcc855f96af72a9f5)

commit_message:
Fix removal of dvr-src mac flows when non-gateway port on router is deleted

Removal of non-gateway port on DVR router deletes all the DVR to
SRC mac flows for the instances of same subnet on that compute node.
The instances are not reachable from any other network.

This patch checks if the DVR router port is gateway for the subnet
or not. And deletes the DVR-SRC mac flows only if it is gateway port.
The DVR-SRC mac flows are deleted if the gateway is not set for the subnet.

Change-Id: Iadc1671c862f8c01e5761e92b82a04849d4bb411
Closes-Bug: #1892405
(cherry picked from commit 329ea19f8b881421b9b5ae2fcc855f96af72a9f5)

commit_message:
Fix pep8 by removing unknown test B322

B322 was used to test a Python 2 specific input method
and is no longer needed as we no longer support Python 2.
https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/662

Change-Id: I87a170210baef22b48b024bcd13e6464be92fd12

commit_message:
not wait when instance evacuate error

When processing host failure notification, if one instance in 'active'
or 'stopped' state evacuates error, the recovery thread still waits
until loopingcall timeout, which makes no sense.

Change-Id: Ib2486fe6df1405d1aa103ddec60fb4209e0460a1
Close-Bug: #1859406

commit_message:
Fix args for initializing trove client

Trove client is using the 'retries' as 'connect_retries' when instantiating
trove Client.

Ref:
https://github.com/openstack/python-troveclient/blob/master/troveclient/client.py#L469

Story: 2008422
Task: 41366

Change-Id: I58a6e235410e2ca28b3822400151621c18ad882d
(cherry picked from commit defb617ce543e3e896a4ce1ef0293f4e76c5f2c0)

commit_message:
Replace Fedora test image with F32

Fedora 31 was retired and the image is gone from mirrors.
heat-cfntools have been dropped from fedora images, disable
the test till that's resolved.

NOTE(elod.illes): the following changes were made compared to the
original patch:

grenade jobs don't need to be non-voting anymore.

bandit removed B322 test, so it needs to be removed from tox.ini, too.

Fix contradicting lower constraints to make lower-constraints job pass.

Change-Id: Id869f83a46454897c2fe7a532eebfa2863befe5e
(cherry picked from commit 61e53c4eca3bc4f0c60754269cb2811afc569705)
(cherry picked from commit 779b39c975c32e8fd0a3982197787c294cf92589)

commit_message:
Fix endless periodic looping call after failed evacuation

Fixes an issue where a failed evacuation could result in a periodic
looping call to run forever. This happened because the periodic call was
not stopped after a timeout occurred.

Change-Id: Id3b9bad4bc617c168200d34d69bbe760a24dfcf9
Closes-Bug: #1897888

commit_message:
Add double quotes for empty in devstack setting

A variable itself is treated as an evaluation expression,
so when it is empty, a syntax error will occur and devstack setting
will fail. This patch fixes it.

Change-Id: I360054f78dba04b05cc2ae171f656babbb576de9

commit_message:
redfish-virtual-media: make fewer calls when preparing boot

Currently we're loading a new System and ManagerCollection on each
operation. Cache the ManagerCollection instead.

Change-Id: I0ec9630003b31e869703e75ffcea1ece90ac3dc2

commit_message:
nova: Use LIBGUESTFS_BACKEND=direct

After change [1] nova-compute launch libguestfs using the default
``qemu:///system``, but when ``inject_password` is set to true and
user tries to create vm, the vm creation is successful and we could
see libguestfs error in nova-compute logs.

This change forces libvirt to use ``direct`` when launching instances
on host.

[1] Ib55936ea562dfa965be0764647e2b8e3fa309fd6

Change-Id: I195358742c19d6ea0a3d32979896c0268e3b55a6
Closes-bug: #1912141

(cherry picked from commit 67917bf65076ce8a0aeb568e48d28dd1bd1f2995)

Change-Id: I8b18490b434c6b62e65044ffc6a14545b7d4c505

recheck'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-18 02:06:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

To: Takahashi-san
Seems that devstack@ceilometer-acompute.service fails to run on the controller node. (https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/190bd47e2faf441f9c791d4bbe4803dc/console#3/0/1/controller)

How about rechecking with the following diff?

diff --git a/.zuul.yaml b/.zuul.yaml
index 651ac44dfdf5..48f56b872cf8 100644
--- a/.zuul.yaml
+++ b/.zuul.yaml
@@ -112,7 +112,7 @@
           n-api: true
           n-api-meta: true
           n-cond: true
-          n-cpu: false
+          n-cpu: true
           n-novnc: true
           n-sch: true
           placement-api: true'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-18 05:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Or, applying the following patch to localrc, I think we can suppress ceilometer compute agent on the controller node.

diff --git a/.zuul.yaml b/.zuul.yaml
index 651ac44dfdf5..92c7ce56b0a3 100644
--- a/.zuul.yaml
+++ b/.zuul.yaml
@@ -97,6 +97,8 @@
           tacker: https://opendev.org/openstack/tacker
           blazar: https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar
           fenix: https://opendev.org/x/fenix
+        devstack_localrc:
+          VIRT_DRIVER: fake
         devstack_services:
           # Core services enabled for this branch.
           # This list replaces the test-matrix.'}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-11-18 05:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thank you for your suggestion.
I think it is better that suppressing ceilometer compute agent on the controller node. I'll try it.
If failed again, I'll also try to recheck with running nova compute on controller."}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2020-11-18 05:47:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I prefer later one, `VIRT_DRIVER: fake` if it works because we'd better to reduce memory usage on controller node."}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-11-18 05:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-18 08:59:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Seems that the new job.host-vars "devstack_localrc" for the controller overrides all the previous definitions. We should've define "VIRT_DRIVER: fake" in job.vars, which does merge definitions, then explicitly overrides in "devstack_localrc" for subnodes like "VIRT_DRIVER: libvirt" because anyway the whole "devstack_localrc" is supposed to be overridden as for subnodes.


diff --git a/.zuul.yaml b/.zuul.yaml
index 651ac44dfdf5..1c17274ffb50 100644
--- a/.zuul.yaml
+++ b/.zuul.yaml
@@ -75,6 +75,7 @@
         Q_SERVICE_PLUGIN_CLASSES: router,neutron.services.metering.metering_plugin.MeteringPlugin,networking_sfc.services.flowclassifier.plugin.FlowClassifierPlugin,neutron.services.qos.qos_plugin.QoSPlugin,qos
         Q_ML2_PLUGIN_EXT_DRIVERS: port_security,qos
         L2_AGENT_EXTENSIONS: qos
+        VIRT_DRIVER: fake
       devstack_local_conf:
         post-config:
           $NEUTRON_DHCP_CONF:
@@ -153,6 +154,7 @@
           PHYSICAL_NETWORK: mgmtphysnet0
           OVS_BRIDGE_MAPPINGS: public:br-ex,mgmtphysnet0:br-infra
           DATABASE_TYPE: mysql
+          VIRT_DRIVER: libvirt
         devstack_services:
           q-agt: true
           n-api: false'}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-11-18 13:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 03:00:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 05:37:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Now the only failure is of test_vnf_alarm_scale_with_instance_reservation[1] so let me "recheck".

BTW, aside from it, there seems to be (at least) three sporadic FT failures given the 1:06 AM result.

[1]: see the commit message in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/762771/1'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 05:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 07:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Please let me investigate with Patch Set 7.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 08:03:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 08:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 08:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

PatchSet7 doesn't contain '--since "$(cat {{ devstack_base_dir }}/log-start-timestamp.txt)"'. Sorry to bother you.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 10:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-19 14:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The ansible debug output [1] shows that after all FT finishes,
- mysqld uses about 10% of the total memory
- the other processes consume 0~2% for each
and the system almost runs out of memory [2]. 8GB is too small for us. So I think we should follow the two steps as below:

(step1). add a label "ubuntu-focal-16GB" or "ubuntu-focal-32GB"
     - I'm not sure project-config.git, IIUC, will accept it
     - Airship is possibly gonna require the latter? (ref. Change Ie0293d0523f8a9a738015035725ea2e40b152d3d)
(step2). until (1) is merged (or rejected),
     (a). reduce mysqld memory usage (hopefully -100~400MB)
          - disable performance_schema
          - set innodb buffer pool size to half the default (128MB->64MB)
          - etc.
     (b). consider splitting controller node (probably deploying a seperate network node)

Any thoughts?

[1]: https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/cb232fcd0e9c4139b103875f94cba0e2/console#5/0/20/controller
[2]: https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/cb232fcd0e9c4139b103875f94cba0e2/console#5/0/22/controller'}, {'account_id': 25701, 'date': '2020-11-19 18:11:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Many thank for sharing your inspections. I'm not negative to increase memory, but would like to know why 8GB is not enough when reverting ceilometer exactly because we may be asked the reason while asking to increase. Do you have any idea?"}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-11-19 18:26:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Thank you for a great investigation.

Step1 is good for us, but I'm not sure that it is accepted as you said... 

Is the failure because of the Ceilometer? Or basically our test use lots of memory and Ceilometer is just a trigger?
How about executing a similar investigation without a Ceilometer?
Does it help us decide whether to ask Ceilometer something or to ask increase node memory?"}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-20 00:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

Ogawa-san, even without ceilometer, system memory seems to be almost fully consumed. So disabling devstack@ceilometer-acompute on controller with a patch [1] would be just a temporary workaround.

* Top 10 high memory-consuming processes (+ ceilometer-related processes) (*the output [2] processed)
  808.70MB (9.87%) 828112 /usr/sbin/mysqld
  179.81MB (2.19%) 184124 /usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/tacker-server --config-file /etc/tacker/tacker.conf
  152.57MB (1.86%) 156232 /usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/tacker-conductor --config-file /etc/tacker/tacker.conf
  146.67MB (1.79%) 150188 /usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/neutron-server --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
  132.96MB (1.62%) 136148 /usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/neutron-server --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini
  129.08MB (1.58%) 132180 /usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/heat-engine --config-file=/etc/heat/heat.conf
  127.48MB (1.56%) 130544 /usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/heat-engine --config-file=/etc/heat/heat.conf
  122.16MB (1.49%) 125092 nova-apiuWSGI worker 1
  121.00MB (1.48%) 123900 neutron-openvswitch-agent (/usr/bin/python3.8 /usr/local/bin/neutron-openvswitch-agent --config-file /etc/neutron/neutron.conf --config-file /etc/neutron/plugins/ml2/ml2_conf.ini)
  119.50MB (1.46%) 122368 cinder-apiuWSGI worker 1
  ------(snip)------
   64.40MB (0.79%) 65948 ceilometer-agent-notification: NotificationService worker(1)
   62.22MB (0.76%) 63716 ceilometer-agent-notification: NotificationService worker(0)
   52.20MB (0.64%) 53452 ceilometer-polling: AgentManager worker(0)
   44.52MB (0.54%) 45584 ceilometer-polling: AgentManager worker(0)
   35.36MB (0.43%) 36204 ceilometer-agent-notification: master process [/usr/local/bin/ceilometer-agent-notification --config-file /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf]
   34.72MB (0.42%) 35556 ceilometer-polling: master process [/usr/local/bin/ceilometer-polling --polling-namespaces compute --config-file /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf]
   32.36MB (0.40%) 33136 ceilometer-polling: master process [/usr/local/bin/ceilometer-polling --polling-namespaces central --config-file /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf]

Of course it would be better if ceilometer.git:devstack/plugin.sh 

[1]: like this:

diff --git a/devstack/plugin.sh b/devstack/plugin.sh
index dd5a15e24db0..201670223ce4 100644
--- a/devstack/plugin.sh
+++ b/devstack/plugin.sh
@@ -343,13 +343,16 @@ function start_ceilometer {
 
     # Start the compute agent late to allow time for the notification agent to
     # fully wake up and connect to the message bus. See bug #1355809
-    if [[ "$VIRT_DRIVER" = 'libvirt' ]]; then
-        run_process ceilometer-acompute "$CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR/ceilometer-polling --polling-namespaces compute --config-file $CEILOMETER_CONF" $LIBVIRT_GROUP
-    fi
-    if [[ "$VIRT_DRIVER" = 'vsphere' ]]; then
-        run_process ceilometer-acompute "$CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR/ceilometer-polling --polling-namespaces compute --config-file $CEILOMETER_CONF"
+    if is_service_enabled ceilometer-acompute; then
+        if [[ "$VIRT_DRIVER" = 'libvirt' ]]; then
+        if is_service_enabled ceilometer-acentral ceilometer-acompute ceilometer-anotification gnocchi-api gnocchi-metricd; then
+            run_process ceilometer-acompute "$CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR/ceilometer-polling --polling-namespaces compute --config-file $CEILOMETER_CONF" $LIBVIRT_GROUP
+        fi
+        if [[ "$VIRT_DRIVER" = 'vsphere' ]]; then
+            run_process ceilometer-acompute "$CEILOMETER_BIN_DIR/ceilometer-polling --polling-namespaces compute --config-file $CEILOMETER_CONF"
+        fi
     fi
-}
+)


[2]: https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/cb232fcd0e9c4139b103875f94cba0e2/console#5/0/20/controller'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-11-20 00:26:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

I have a question. Ceilometer components are installed and running on the controller and controller-tacker now. Is there any necessary component which should be running on the compute node ? (ex. I wonder where should ceilometer-acompute run.)'}, {'account_id': 17255, 'date': '2020-12-17 05:29:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

> Patch Set 13:
> 
> I have a question. Ceilometer components are installed and running on the controller and controller-tacker now. Is there any necessary component which should be running on the compute node ? (ex. I wonder where should ceilometer-acompute run.)

In my understanding, ceilometer-acompute runs in each compute node. But I'm not sure that it should be necessary. I think that the lack of the agent only leads to not collect the numbers, does not cause an error. If the agent is needed, the result may be our FT error.
So I'll try to resolve devstack error first, that is not compute setting."}, {'account_id': 4149, 'date': '2020-12-22 22:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-12-23 04:40:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 32395, 'date': '2020-12-23 04:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

[{'created': '2020-10-28 20:38:19.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Revert Ceilometer install

Revert Ceiloemter install which was removed in the following

commit_message:
Restore Ceilometer installation

This reverts [1], with some complementary bits and pieces.
Historically it'd been deactivated twice on master branch.
See also [3], which was reverted in [2]. Note this reverts
[4] as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/757537
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/754882
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/751965
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/760275

Change-Id: I9c9cc65772b2f88c5ed7ef8178b79aa5c7011f29

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-08-25 13:12:17.000000000', 'message': "Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

If LDAP returns a UUID as an octet string the LDAP driver will fail to
convert it to something meaningful. The error usually looks something
like:

  ID attribute objectGUID not found in LDAP object

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py due to python2 and
      python3 compatibility.

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)
"}, {'created': '2020-08-27 15:53:07.000000000', 'message': "Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py due to python2 and

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)

commit_message:
Properly handle octet (byte) strings when converting LDAP responses

If LDAP returns a UUID as an octet string the LDAP driver will fail to
convert it to something meaningful. The error usually looks something
like:

  ID attribute objectGUID not found in LDAP object

Microsoft AD's `objectGUID` parameter is stored and transmitted as an
octet string [0]. If you attempt to use the `objectGUID` to generate
user or group IDs, you'll get an HTTP 404 because keystone can't decode
it properly. This is unfortunate because `objectGUID` are a fixed
length, UUID format, and ideal for generating IDs in keystone. As
opposed to using the object's CN, which is variable length, and can
generate hashes that are larger than keystone's database table limit for
user IDs.

[0] https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/ad/reading-an-objectampaposs-objectguid-and-creating-a-string-representation-of-the-guid

Conflicts:
      keystone/identity/backends/ldap/common.py

      Due to python2 -> python3 migration code.

Change-Id: Id80b17bdff015e10340e636102576b7435bd564f
Closes-Bug: 1889936
(cherry picked from commit 8bf222ac5d390e25d306d35f69bd958b18bee4d8)
(cherry picked from commit d5870f69c12c034dd97b164345e85e6259ee7abe)

commit_message:
Extend address group notification data

* Instead of just passing address group id in callback notifications, now
  we pass all the object fields info.

* Also fixed the create_address_group notification order to ensure the create
  event is sent before the update event.

Change-Id: I7978d5a9b1b03027a1ba7c3aed61aff4b918081b
Implements: blueprint address-groups-in-sg-rules

commit_message:
Policy json to yaml migration

Adds the status upgrade check for the JSON to YAML migration
effort and updates the documentation where it seems appropriate
to move from "policy.json" to "policy.yaml"

Mostly shamelessly copied from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/748059/
however is in-line with ironic's configuration and patching methods.

Related Blueprint: policy-json-to-yaml

Change-Id: I1d5b3892451579ebfd4d75a0f7185e0ef3c984c8

[{'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2014-12-08 05:48:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2014-12-08 05:48:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. The more you
    participate in the community the more rewarding it is for you. You may also
    notice that the more you get to know people and get to be known, the faster
    your patches will be reviewed and eventually approved. Get to know others
    and become known by doing code reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a
    great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Gerrit_Workflow
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2014-12-08 05:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

(8 comments)

I don't actually see that there needs to be any change to the way Nova does anything from a REST API perspective. The existing Nova -> Neutron -> Nova callbacks system for retrieving port binding information should be perfectly fine for returning the physical network information for an SR-IOV VF. Please see more comments inline.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6772, 'date': '2014-12-13 19:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

there's a bug in nova.   this bug is out of this spec.
 nova sometimes will ignore the failure of any device detach, not only sirov.
 in these case, if detach failed, it can take effect on the net reboot, for the persistent has changed. 
 see my comments in： 
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/139910/14/specs/mitaka/approved/sriov-interface-attach-detach.rst
 
I put them here again.

I'd like to talk about the delete instance device of nova. It is a common issue instead of SRIOV
 Here is the libvirt doc string to describe it underly function detachDeviceFlags.
 http://paste.openstack.org/show/480330/
 It says:
 detaching a device from a running domain may be asynchronous.
 and it suggests:
 To check whether the device was successfully removed, either recheck domain
 configuration using virDomainGetXMLDesc() or add handler for
 VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED
 Also Daniel elaborated it, and gave us more some scenarios about it.
 it is not guaranteed to succeed. What happens is that the hypervisor injects
 an ACPI request to unplug the device. The guest OS must co-operate by releasing
 the device, before the hypervisor will complete the action of physically
 removing it. So you require a guest OS that supports ACPI unplug of course,
 and if the guest is crashed or being malicious there is no guarantee the unplug
 will succeed. Libvirt will wait a short while for success, but you must monitor
 for libvirt events to see if/when it finally completes. This delayed release has
 implications for when Nova can mark the PCI device as unused and available for
 other guests to assign.
 Now I have checked the code, both detach volume or detach interface call
    5   1220  nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py <<detach_volume>>
              guest . detach_device ( conf , persistent = True , live = live )
    6   1280  nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py <<detach_interface>>
              guest . detach_device ( cfg , persistent = True , live = live )
    7   3016  nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py <<_detach_pci_devices>>
              guest . detach_device ( self . _get_guest_pci_device ( dev ) , live = True )
    8   3105  nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py <<_detach_sriov_ports>>
              guest . detach_device ( cfg , live = True )
 And for detach_interface in nova/compute/manager.py:
     @wrap_exception()
     @wrap_instance_fault
     def detach_interface(self, context, instance, port_id):
         """Detach an network adapter from an instance."""
         network_info = instance.info_cache.network_info
         condemned = None
         for vif in network_info:
             if vif['id'] == port_id:
                 condemned = vif
                 break
         if condemned is None:
             raise exception.PortNotFound(_("Port %s is not "
                                            "attached") % port_id)
         try:
             self.driver.detach_interface(instance, condemned)
         except exception.NovaException as ex:
             LOG.warning(_LW("Detach interface failed, port_id=%(port_id)s,"
                             " reason: %(msg)s"),
                         {'port_id': port_id, 'msg': ex}, instance=instance)
             raise exception.InterfaceDetachFailed(instance_uuid=instance.uuid)
         else:
             try:
                 self.network_api.deallocate_port_for_instance(
                     context, instance, port_id)
             except Exception as ex:
                 with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception():
                     # Since this is a cast operation, log the failure for
                     # triage.
                     LOG.warning(_LW('Failed to deallocate port %(port_id)s '
                                     'for instance. Error: %(error)s'),
                                 {'port_id': port_id, 'error': ex},
                                 instance=instance)
 It just detach_interface, no double check the device is detached finally.
 Now I will support the detach SRIOV code.
 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/139910/
 I'm not sure should I need to double check the device is finally detached.
 If yes.
 What should I support?
 3 options:
 1. Just ignored it. keep the nova code.
 2. sync check.
 as the libvirt suggests: use virDomainGetXMLDesc()
 def detach_interface(self, context, instance, port_id):
    self.driver.detach_interface(instance, condemned)
    # just pseudo-code
    for i in range(1, 51):
       if not(virDomainGetXMLDesc()):
            sleep(1)
        else if i == 51：
            raise exception
        else:
            break
    self.network_api.deallocate_port_for_instance(
        context, instance, port_id)
 3. async notification.
  as the libvirt suggests:
 add event handler for VIR_DOMAIN_EVENT_ID_DEVICE_REMOVED.
 call network_api.deallocate_port_for_instance in a backend task.
 The backend receives the event result from event handler by AMPQ and filter the
 device is the the expected interface device, not the volume device.
 Then backend call network_api.deallocate_port_for_instance to deallocate the port.
 I have not check the volume detach, not sure it has the same issues.
 Beside this issue:
 But from the libvirt Doc string,
 hypervisors may prevent this operation if there is a current
 block copy operation on the device being detached;'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2015-12-01 17:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

patch set 17 fix typo.'}, {'account_id': 7543, 'date': '2015-12-01 17:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14131, 'date': '2015-12-01 17:15:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

any reviewer,

 nova does not double check the device(not only sriov) is finally detached. 

 this spec will not fix this nova bug. it is out of this spec.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-12-01 17:24:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17: Verified+1

This matches the Zun setup to other common components such as
Nova and Cinder, with an aim to reduce the number of CI failures.

Change-Id: I89a836c5e07b2df8d65a784f3bee60bc4966bcfd

commit_message:
Restrict zun thread/process count for AIO deployments

This matches the Zun setup to other common components such as
Nova and Cinder, with an aim to reduce the number of CI failures.

Change-Id: I89a836c5e07b2df8d65a784f3bee60bc4966bcfd

commit_message:
Sync boot mode when changing the boot device via Redfish

After changing the boot device via Redfish, check that the boot mode being
reported matches what is configured and, if not, set it to the configured
value.  Some BMCs change the boot mode when the device is set via Redfish,
this will ensure the mode is set properly.

Change-Id: Ib077f7f32de029833e6bd936853c382305bce36e
Story: 2008252
Task: 41103
(cherry picked from commit 685131fd3658b2ff0b131d19d32fd82d74f3bb17)
(cherry picked from commit 861e91c8616db39e589589629bd5305909067331)
(cherry picked from commit a6f38ab05a64802aec1b17c058e62ce7244e9a81)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-18 15:52:21.000000000', 'message': "Make get ceph_mon_ip addresses task composable network compatible

Do not assume we will always have hostvars[<node>]['storage_ip'].
Instead use the service_net_map, found in global_vars.yaml of
config-download. Within this directory, if ceph_mon on the list
tripleo_enabled_services, then there will be a service_net_map
containing the ceph_mon_network. As per tripleo_common/inventory.py,
this network name, whatever it is composed to, will have an '_ip'
appended to it which will map to the correct IP address. Without
network isolation ceph_mon_network will default to ctlplane. With
network isolation it will default to storage, but it could also
be composed to anything, so we can use this method to pick up
whatever it is.

Closes-Bug: #1912218
Change-Id: I7c1052b1c27ea91c5f97f59ec80c906d60d5f13e
"}]
commit_message:
Make get ceph_mon_ip addresses task composable network compatible

Do not assume we will always have hostvars[<node>]['storage_ip'].
Instead use the service_net_map, found in global_vars.yaml of
config-download. Within this directory, if ceph_mon on the list
tripleo_enabled_services, then there will be a service_net_map
containing the ceph_mon_network. As per tripleo_common/inventory.py,
this network name, whatever it is composed to, will have an '_ip'
appended to it which will map to the correct IP address. Without
network isolation ceph_mon_network will default to ctlplane. With
network isolation it will default to storage, but it could also
be composed to anything, so we can use this method to pick up
whatever it is.

Closes-Bug: #1912218
Change-Id: I7c1052b1c27ea91c5f97f59ec80c906d60d5f13e

commit_message:
Setting available_features for stable branch

available_features for Neutron tempest tests is default to "all" and
used from Victoria to enable/disable tests that has no API extension.
It is added here to make sure that stable gating will not execute these
tests (like for IPv6 metadata in neutron-tempest-plugin or updating
min_bw QoS values for port already attached to VMs)

Cherry-picked from stable/victoria patch
(https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/769885), but the list
for available_features is empty on Ussuri and Train.

Change-Id: Ic6056218e51e6b0da554bcdf139214d2229ba3c1
Related-Bug: #1882804

commit_message:
Remove unicode prefix from strings

In python3, all strings are considered as unicode strings
and the unicode prefix ("u") for string is no longer needed.
This commit cleans up "u" prefix in the repository.

Change-Id: I30a9f5314aef1160766af608043c073d333f1bff

subject: List setuptools under install_requires
messages:
[{'account_id': 32479, 'date': '2020-10-01 09:17:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2020-10-01 09:17:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 32479, 'date': '2020-10-01 09:18:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-10-29 11:34:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Is this truly necessary? Has this been discussed anywhere?'}, {'account_id': 32479, 'date': '2020-10-29 11:40:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi,
I am not aware of it being discussed elsewhere but failing to list it can cause QA issues for Gentoo's Python build system.

Even though setuptools is used to install the package, it should be listed in runtime dependencies as well, just in case someone uninstalls it."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-11-06 11:15:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Fair enough. Harmless enough'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2020-11-09 12:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 32057, 'date': '2021-01-18 23:44:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This didn't fix the problem, actually -- setuptools is still missing in egg-info/requires.txt.  I think pbr is overwriting install_requires with whatever's in requirements.txt, so setuptools should be added there."}]

commit_message:
List setuptools under install_requires

pkg_resources is used at runtime, making setuptools a runtime
dependency.

Change-Id: Ib1775a319e8ed953cb34e3c09809b8ca7a32b947

commit_message:
Add support for senlin tempest plugin

There do not appear to be RDO packages for python(3)-senlin-tests-tempest
so we only add support for source based deployments.

Change-Id: Ie6e8f1dcc3bb8460edd0fb22edc3d7ef14290574

commit_message:
Support "Implementation" definition as Artifact Name

In the Node templates interfaces definition, Tosca
parser only recognizes implementation as a file and
not as an artifact name. ETSI SOL definition provides
that Implementation may be an artifact name, and that
the artifact definition will specify the artifact
type and the file. This modification will allow both
artifact name and file to be placed as value in
"Implementation" definition.

This is essential to allow onboarding of VNFD
packages containing the Management Driver definition
that specifies both Implementation definition value
as the Artifact Name.

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/740896/

Change-Id: I192d36499e7b731bbefaf3845f23f85d1e649ca5

subject: Fix memory explosion in multi-store image tests
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 8556, 'name': 'Ghanshyam', 'display_name': 'Ghanshyam Mann', 'email': 'gmann@ghanshyammann.com', 'username': 'ghanshyam'}, {'_account_id': 9303, 'name': 'Abhishek Kekane', 'email': 'akekane@redhat.com', 'username': 'abhishekkekane'}, {'_account_id': 9708, 'name': 'Balazs Gibizer', 'display_name': 'gibi', 'email': 'gibizer@gmail.com', 'username': 'gibi'}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 19138, 'name': 'Pranali Deore', 'email': 'pdeore@redhat.com', 'username': 'PranaliD'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22873, 'name': 'Martin Kopec', 'email': 'mkopec@redhat.com', 'username': 'mkopec'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-01-14 19:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-01-14 19:48:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

this lgtm as discussed in IRC. gate result will take time though but it should not cause any issue.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-01-14 22:36:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is there a bug report that goes along with this? I'm interested in what is logged in the gate when the memory ballooning happens."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-01-14 22:52:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Is there a bug report that goes along with this? I'm interested in what is logged in the gate when the memory ballooning happens.

No, I think Lee said he was going to file one but wasn't able to nail down a logstash URL for it.

The most common manifestation I've seen is where the ceph multistore job reports failure, but zero failed tests, and reports that one of the workers never sent its results. Usually you can also see the last test report of "inprogress" instead of "ok" or "fail".

Further, you can see the OOM from the kernel in syslog, and nail the victim to one of the python test workers, which shows about 1.5g of usage.

The easiest way to reproduce it locally is to run tempest like '/usr/bin/time -v tox -eall -- MultiStore' and look at the max resident size in the result. You should see it be ~1.5g with this test, about 65m without it, and the same after applying this patch.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-01-14 22:54:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

BTW, here's the logstash I used this morning:

http://logstash.openstack.org/#dashboard/file/logstash.json?query=message%3A%5C%22tempest.api.image.v2.test_images.MultiStoresImportImagesTest.test_glance_direct_import_image_to_all_stores.*inprogress%5C%22

and here's a failing test example:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/781590c5a8724e6d941bc6b6545794fa

Check the "inprogress" and "Worker 2: N/A" in there.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2021-01-14 23:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thank you for all those details, very interesting stuff. Nice work cracking this case.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-01-15 08:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

thanks for the gate fix!'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2021-01-15 08:02:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:50:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > Is there a bug report that goes along with this? I'm interested in what is logged in the gate when the memory ballooning happens.
> 
> No, I think Lee said he was going to file one but wasn't able to nail down a logstash URL for it.

Yeah apologies I never did write this up in a bug. LGTM lets not hold this up given tempest is branchless anyway so there are not going to be any backports that require a bug report."}, {'account_id': 22873, 'date': '2021-01-18 19:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

LGTM, seems like the size was set to unnecessary big number, 1024 is the default.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-14 19:23:55.000000000', 'message': 'Fix memory explosion in multi-store image tests

For some reason, the MultiStoresImportImages test was causing the
test runner to balloon to ~1.5G, which generates spurious OOMs in
the gate, resulting in worker death and failure.

This test was generating 10M of data with data_utils.random_bytes(),
instead of the default of 1K, for no apparent reason. We are still
not sure why, but this results in the memory ballooning, potentially
because of BytesIO, or request.put() mishandling.

Regardless, this is unnecessary, and causing failures in the gate,
so this patch switches it back to the default, which works fine.

Change-Id: I9f1ea0114531a735bd38ad54da7ce15fb2bf7f7c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix memory explosion in multi-store image tests

For some reason, the MultiStoresImportImages test was causing the
test runner to balloon to ~1.5G, which generates spurious OOMs in
the gate, resulting in worker death and failure.

This test was generating 10M of data with data_utils.random_bytes(),
instead of the default of 1K, for no apparent reason. We are still
not sure why, but this results in the memory ballooning, potentially
because of BytesIO, or request.put() mishandling.

Regardless, this is unnecessary, and causing failures in the gate,
so this patch switches it back to the default, which works fine.

Change-Id: I9f1ea0114531a735bd38ad54da7ce15fb2bf7f7c

[{'created': '2020-12-26 18:54:47.000000000', 'message': '[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein EM

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I89a88f9ef39ebeeeb32bde2ce928f9089fc6086d

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: Id4c39b10e7e6685958a490ece8c37ad66d9769ba

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I011f9be8ae7fbf9fbd638ec769e0fad53531563d

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: Ie0ecdf5f8a2ce2dd200a3293abb8e6a1f0ecf635

plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: Iae762866024bcdeb5e4dbc7c50421861499f7c19

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I4842704dcfce022848ca7903eb5c5b9624ef1470

and we will process a release. If you need to get some important
changes merged first, leave a -1 and update the patch with a new

processed by January 21.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-16 16:32:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location. We'll consider "host" as a lookup
parameter since we can't be sure that export
locations are unique in a deployment - but they
ought to be unique for a given host.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718
Change-Id: I1d1aef0c2b48764789b43b91b258def6464b389f
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1b5771ef15da3be52f54f2177c181020d2479a8b)
(cherry picked from commit 5cff4d4b3f5e721981a19961abc516d0654af548)
(cherry picked from commit a9e0ca254e4b20ef414387fbbfdc7bc4675acc2a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix logic that determines a share exists before manage

The share "manage" API checks whether
an existing/known share is being imported by
matching the export path provided to existing
shares.

This lookup does not consider the
fact that shares may have multiple export
locations, because it relies on an old/deprecated
"export_location" property on shares which
was added to provide backwards compatibility
to the API that presented only one export
location per share.

Further, it's possible to get a
"ERROR: Invalid share: Share already exists"
exception even when no such share exists in the
database.

Fix the lookup by using the "export_location_path"
based lookup which is faster, since it performs
a meaningful join on the export locations table;
and remove the parameters "protocol"
and "share_type_id" - these things make no
difference when there's a duplicated export
location. We'll consider "host" as a lookup
parameter since we can't be sure that export
locations are unique in a deployment - but they
ought to be unique for a given host.

Closes-Bug: #1848608
Closes-Bug: #1893718
Change-Id: I1d1aef0c2b48764789b43b91b258def6464b389f
Co-Authored-By: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1b5771ef15da3be52f54f2177c181020d2479a8b)
(cherry picked from commit 5cff4d4b3f5e721981a19961abc516d0654af548)
(cherry picked from commit a9e0ca254e4b20ef414387fbbfdc7bc4675acc2a)

commit_message:
Use tempest's ServiceClients rather than Manager

tempest.Manager has been deprecated for more than 4 years already.
Tempest plugins are expected to consume
tempest.lib.services.clients.ServiceClients directly.

Change-Id: I614451e909ef2471493f702928db8eff591be037

commit_message:
[GRE] Add possibility to create GRE tunnels over IPv6

In case when IPv6 addresses are used for GRE tunnels, tunnel
type set for the openvswitch interface should be "ip6gre" instead of
"gre" which was set so far.
This patch changes that so now Neutron configures correct GRE tunnel
types.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I557af0bcafac4583ad9726c9bf707cf1fb92ffc5
Closes-Bug: #1904564
(cherry picked from commit 80e6781bc2d2b39e547e80996743d29ec090c816)

commit_message:
Apply urllib.parse.quote in unittests to get_mock_url

Apply quotations to the mock_url so that it is look exactly like it
would be. When using proxy layer and triggering find it is not
impossible to have url like:
https://neutron.example.com/v2.0/ports/my%20port. This change
simplifies size of the followup patch of switching networking cloud
layer to rely on proxy.

Change-Id: If3cb96d1e4413643061bbb5f13ebf28e8c155c75

[{'created': '2020-12-01 14:43:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add a system-reader check string to base.py

This commit adds a new constant to base.py that models a common persona
being implemented across OpenStack called system-reader. We can use this
persona in future patches to update the default policies for the
appropriate APIs.

'}]
commit_message:
Add a system-reader check string to base.py

This commit adds a new constant to base.py that models a common persona
being implemented across OpenStack called system-reader. We can use this
persona in future patches to update the default policies for the
appropriate APIs.

Change-Id: I12074fe328db71895bbdfda3c9e7c56cc6b6f40d

commit_message:
Add service for zun-wsproxy console access

This adds an HAProxy instance for the Zun wsproxy service which
allows containers' console output to be streamed to the Horizon
dashboard.

Change-Id: If5386732d4ba56547d4db85447b83c1bbdafd97c

subject: Add some protection from shadowing mount
messages:
[{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-09-15 14:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2020-09-16 21:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:45:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

This works for me on a fresh install. In cases where the mounts are already in the wrong order they'll need to be addressed slightly more manually."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-01-18 08:51:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 31542, 'date': '2021-01-18 13:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-15 14:45:23.000000000', 'message': "Add some protection from shadowing mount

Currently we do have wrong bind mount order, due to which /var/log/journal
is shadow mounted with later added /var/log mount.
To prevent this we're inserting new mounts before existing ones
in case where they could shadow mount destination.

Change-Id: Id8cca6d83c75202a273df23be353480366ead156
Closes-Bug: #1895533
"}]
commit_message:
Add some protection from shadowing mount

Currently we do have wrong bind mount order, due to which /var/log/journal
is shadow mounted with later added /var/log mount.
To prevent this we're inserting new mounts before existing ones
in case where they could shadow mount destination.

Change-Id: Id8cca6d83c75202a273df23be353480366ead156
Closes-Bug: #1895533

commit_message:
Use yaml instead of json for policy file

Because usage of json for policy file will be deprecated and replaced
by yaml[1].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/wallaby/migrate-policy-format-from-json-to-yaml.html

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/769647
Change-Id: I2d1dc5791f18d10e9947f962b796872e7d6990e1

commit_message:
Fix CA certificate on cloud-compute relation

Note that part of this fix belongs in c-h, but let's add it here
as a tactical measure given we are practically frozen.

Enable TLS in the functional test for focal-ussuri and onwards.

Also switch to focal-ussuri as target for smoke.

Drop Trusty/Mitaka as it currently does not pass with symptoms
like https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-nova-compute/+bug/1861094

Closes-Bug: #1911902
Change-Id: I7b12479ce3afb94a0fb21c26b1ac78736b81aba2

commit_message:
Create ceph directories in config-download without become

Given how config-download runs in the main branch it's no longer
necessary to use become when creating the work directories for
ceph-ansible to be executed or when running the tripleo_ceph_client
role. Using become introduces the bug this change resolves. Also,
as we are not using become we won't set the owner of the directory.
Instead we will use the default owner of whoever created the directory.

Change-Id: I65cd66ed5c94b548b775b9b4829717c202837d7e
Closes-Bug: #1912103

commit_message:
Add support for UBI8 as a subcase of Centos8

This reverts the reverted feature commit f3a5d4525b2b34af89b84db929d0efab244326e2.

Fix use of distro-specific paths for UBI as well

Change-Id: Ibd72a43d7f9eb631c07a44320df746845d70408e
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Build openafs 1.8.7 on centos

The openafs 1.8.7 release fixes a fatal bug in 1.8.6 that occurs after
January 14, 2021. Bump up the version to 1.8.7 to package up the fix.

Change-Id: I83fea73f0f68d297ed95b14c29cc1e6bb12d6d5d

commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Change-Id: I34ab133e218340d21a1b81dc329e7e684872843d

Policy override task without tags requires a lot of time to just

commit_message:
Added tags for policy override task

Policy override task without tags requires a lot of time to just
change policy.json file. cinder-config tag wasn't included either, so
it was added to this task as well. In my system new tag requires 10
times less time than cinder-config, so additional tag is reasonable.

Change-Id: I343dc39f2276e313b4142e6cd494f195e4514ce1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-23 13:03:21.000000000', 'message': 'Improve SelfSign cert generation method

subject alternate name(SAN) is currently injected into
the subject name through the subj parameter of openssl
cli .

However , in this method the certificate does not conatin
X509v3 Subject Alternative Name: attributes .

There may be scnerio where the openstack services need to be
accessed using ip address or domain name which differs from
subject name. Absense of  Properly formated SAN in the
certificate will lead to connection refusal and lot of
troubleshooting by the user. Hence in this patch  the
certificate has been generated from a certificate signing
request configuration file which captures SAN in
proper format.

Although for production usage , a commercial certificate is
suggested , for those cases where self-siged cert suffices
the purpose , this patch will help solve troubleshooting and
manual steps to reconfigure the haproxy ssl .

The deployment guide documentation also need to be modified
accordingly.

Change-Id: If808ca123988a7c17964e0542dd0833fea2bc6fd
Closes-Bug: #1783121

commit_message:
Improve SelfSign cert generation method

subject alternate name(SAN) is currently injected into
the subject name through the subj parameter of openssl
cli .

However , in this method the certificate does not conatin
X509v3 Subject Alternative Name: attributes .

There may be scnerio where the openstack services need to be
accessed using ip address or domain name which differs from
subject name. Absense of  Properly formated SAN in the
certificate will lead to connection refusal and lot of
troubleshooting by the user. Hence in this patch  the
certificate has been generated from a certificate signing
request configuration file which captures SAN in
proper format.

Although for production usage , a commercial certificate is
suggested , for those cases where self-siged cert suffices
the purpose , this patch will help solve troubleshooting and
manual steps to reconfigure the haproxy ssl .

The deployment guide documentation also need to be modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1783121
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/606081/

Change-Id: If808ca123988a7c17964e0542dd0833fea2bc6fd

[{'created': '2019-04-15 13:03:15.000000000', 'message': 'Support setting docker registry swift region

Add the [docker_registry] config group to magnum.conf, and support
setting magnum_docker_registry_swift_region under it.

Change-Id: Ie8cb27dc5a65f3e8251b3b4a945a1e9c54ec2bb9
'}, {'created': '2019-04-15 14:20:06.000000000', 'message': 'Support setting docker registry swift region

Add the [docker_registry] config group to magnum.conf, and support
setting swift_region under it via a new `magnum_swift_service_region`

commit_message:
Support docker registry config options

Add the [docker_registry] config group to magnum.conf, and support
setting `swift_region` and `swift_registry_container` under it.

For consistency in service region configuration, add a new
`magnum_swift_service_region` variable that defaults to
`magnum_service_region`.

To avoid second-guessing Magnum's current default of "docker_registry",
refrain from providing a default value to `swift_registry_container`.

Change-Id: Ie8cb27dc5a65f3e8251b3b4a945a1e9c54ec2bb9
Closes-Bug: #1826432

subject: Adds haproxy certificate to containers
messages:
[{'account_id': 6541, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6541, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:10:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-02-27 09:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

The root cause of the SSL error appears to be a bug in heat where the endpoints are handled incorrectly. There is no guarantee that the Openstack mgmt network can contact the external endpoint in all deployments so we should not rely on there being connectivity to the external endpoint from the heat container.'}, {'account_id': 6541, 'date': '2019-02-27 10:00:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks for review. What would be the fix in stbale/Rocky for that issue? 3 months ago there was a change-set https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619355/ where external endpoints where used in www_authenticate_uri instead of internals. This makes heat in stable/rocky not working at all. According to documentation www_authenticate_uri should not use 'admin' endpoint."}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-02-27 10:06:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Thanks for review. What would be the fix in stbale/Rocky for that
 > issue? 3 months ago there was a change-set https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619355/
 > where external endpoints where used in www_authenticate_uri instead
 > of internals. This makes heat in stable/rocky not working at all.
 > According to documentation www_authenticate_uri should not use
 > 'admin' endpoint.

I am not sure that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619355/ was appropriate, becasue it only works for a subset of deployments, and as you have found breaks a whole bunch of others.

That patch will make things work under two very specific conditions, 1) that the openstack mgmt network can route or NAT to the external endpoint 2) that the external endpoint SSL certificate is trusted by the heat container.

Your patch addresses the second point but the first is still not guaranteed in all environments.

I posted to openstack-discuss requesting help from the heat team here http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003200.html but there has not yet been a good reply to that."}, {'account_id': 6541, 'date': '2019-02-27 11:46:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> > Thanks for review. What would be the fix in stbale/Rocky for that
 > > issue? 3 months ago there was a change-set https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619355/
 > > where external endpoints where used in www_authenticate_uri
 > instead
 > > of internals. This makes heat in stable/rocky not working at all.
 > > According to documentation www_authenticate_uri should not use
 > > 'admin' endpoint.
 > 
 > I am not sure that https://review.openstack.org/#/c/619355/ was
 > appropriate, becasue it only works for a subset of deployments, and
 > as you have found breaks a whole bunch of others.
 > 
 > That patch will make things work under two very specific
 > conditions, 1) that the openstack mgmt network can route or NAT to
 > the external endpoint 2) that the external endpoint SSL certificate
 > is trusted by the heat container.
 > 
 > Your patch addresses the second point but the first is still not
 > guaranteed in all environments.
 > 
 > I posted to openstack-discuss requesting help from the heat team
 > here http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-February/003200.html
 > but there has not yet been a good reply to that.

Thanks for explanation. I read the post in mailing list and now I understand your point, but to make everything properly it looks like significant change in Heat is needed and it can take a while (not in Stein probably). 

Even if this change doesn't fix all conditions, it fixes at least bug which hits deployments where external endpoint is accessible from mgmt network and makes heat available at least for some deployments in Rocky and Stein. 

When whole idea of admin/internal/public in heat will be reworked as is suggested in mailing-list, many changes will be needed to do in deployment anyway and we can remove certificate installation task in heat role then."}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2019-03-02 01:27:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Just a comment to say the workaround mentioned in the bug report corrected the errors I encountered with heat and magnum 

Thank you Kamil!'}, {'account_id': 5805, 'date': '2019-03-02 01:29:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I should have also noted that I am running stable/rocky'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-03-02 09:11:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> I should have also noted that I am running stable/rocky

Yes this patch will fix the specific issue with heat. My -2 is because this patch is adding a very specific workaround for heat, embedded into the playbooks. We should instead be adding entirely generic code to the OSA openstack-hosts role which installs as many CA certs as are needed, to any hosts/containers. The behaviour should be driven by userspace data added to user_variables or host_vars/group_vars.

I have no problem with adding code to OSA to distribute CA certs, we just need to do it in a way which is generic and also covers other use cases, for example keystone needing to auth against an LDAP server with a specific company CA.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-03-02 09:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Yes this patch will fix the specific issue with heat. 

The should be "work around the specific issue with heat, for some deployments" the underlying bugs still exist as now discussed on the mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-01-18 18:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandoning this as the bug is now fixed in heat and we have a means to distribute user supplied CA certificates'}]

commit_message:
Adds haproxy certificate to containers

Some services needs to access external haproxy endpoints.
Usualy, there is TLS configured on external endpoints.
In order to succesfully verify against the endpoints
we need to have haproxy certificates in container.
This task adds the certificate to system certificate store,
which can be used by all services in container.

Closes-Bug: 1814909
Change-Id: I0c33ba857e42c92b75ba8a8b94e5fbbad30a75b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-22 02:00:12.000000000', 'message': "Allow different token caches for policy tests

The 'existing' tests will need users with credentials other than admin
and member, and the secure-rbac tests will need different credentials
again. This change allows a per-test token cache, and defines the
required credentials for the 'existing' tests.

Change-Id: Ief00e16da32a5196c21920c317c309241f2ad1cb
"}, {'created': '2021-01-13 18:55:52.000000000', 'message': "WIP Allow different token caches for policy tests

The 'existing' tests will need users with credentials other than admin
and member, and the secure-rbac tests will need different credentials
again. This change allows a per-test token cache, and defines the
required credentials for the 'existing' tests.

Change-Id: Ief00e16da32a5196c21920c317c309241f2ad1cb
"}, {'created': '2021-01-13 19:13:46.000000000', 'message': "WIP Allow different token caches for policy tests

The 'existing' tests will need users with credentials other than admin
and member, and the secure-rbac tests will need different credentials
again. This change allows a per-test token cache, and defines the
required credentials for the 'existing' tests.

Change-Id: Ief00e16da32a5196c21920c317c309241f2ad1cb
"}, {'created': '2021-01-13 21:05:19.000000000', 'message': "Enable testing to dynamicly leverage ACL roles

The 'existing' tests will need users with credentials other than admin
and member, and the secure-rbac tests will need different credentials
again.

As this no longer uses a cache, and is dynamically generated and passed
the actual *token* vality is not checked, and all ACL testing uses
role values.

Change-Id: Ief00e16da32a5196c21920c317c309241f2ad1cb
"}]
commit_message:
Enable testing to dynamicly leverage ACL roles

The 'existing' tests will need users with credentials other than admin
and member, and the secure-rbac tests will need different credentials
again.

As this no longer uses a cache, and is dynamically generated and passed
the actual *token* vality is not checked, and all ACL testing uses
role values.

Change-Id: Ief00e16da32a5196c21920c317c309241f2ad1cb

commit_message:
Added tag for just policy override reconfiguration

When you change policy on a running system, you expect that
this operation will be fast enough and only change policy.json
Without this tag you have to run whole role.

Use tag: nova-policy-override to just override policy.json

Added nova-config and services restart to the same task

Change-Id: I973658b6a7a7be9f836c603c39d5b11836761d5d

commit_message:
[GRE] Add possibility to create GRE tunnels over IPv6

In case when IPv6 addresses are used for GRE tunnels, tunnel
type set for the openvswitch interface should be "ip6gre" instead of
"gre" which was set so far.
This patch changes that so now Neutron configures correct GRE tunnel
types.

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/functional/agent/common/test_ovs_lib.py

Change-Id: I557af0bcafac4583ad9726c9bf707cf1fb92ffc5
Closes-Bug: #1904564
(cherry picked from commit 80e6781bc2d2b39e547e80996743d29ec090c816)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-01 14:43:10.000000000', 'message': "Update requirements for secure RBAC work

This commit updates the versions of oslo.policy, keystonemiddleware, and
oslo.log to new versions that aid in implementing secure RBAC through
default roles and scope checking.

This commit also includes a dependency on oslo.context, which provides
pythonic context objects based on request environments. This is useful
in implementing authorization decisions because we can just pass context
objects to oslo.policy's Enforcer() object instead of building a
dictionary of authorization information manually.

These dependencies will be used in a subsequent patch set to update
Panko's default policies.

Change-Id: I222155c8c6b757fd80b30173fd300e2a7240c107
"}]
commit_message:
Update requirements for secure RBAC work

This commit updates the versions of oslo.policy, keystonemiddleware, and
oslo.log to new versions that aid in implementing secure RBAC through
default roles and scope checking.

This commit also includes a dependency on oslo.context, which provides
pythonic context objects based on request environments. This is useful
in implementing authorization decisions because we can just pass context
objects to oslo.policy's Enforcer() object instead of building a
dictionary of authorization information manually.

These dependencies will be used in a subsequent patch set to update
Panko's default policies.

Change-Id: I222155c8c6b757fd80b30173fd300e2a7240c107

enhanced token scope checking and default roles, including a read-only
role for GET APIs.

commit_message:
Implement secure RBAC for alarms and quota policies

This commit updates the default policies to include supports for
enhanced token scope checking and default roles, including a read-only
role for GET APIs.

This is part of a broader change across OpenStack projects to
consolidate common personas and provide a more secure and consistent
authorization experience for end users and operators.

Change-Id: If17dbfec10302c9c57d814cb406faee1a6efc59a

commit_message:
Deprecate agent commands and APIs

The os-agents APIs have been removed by the following change.

  I9512f605dd2b3b0e88c951ed086250d57056303d

This patch makes commands related to the APIs deprecated
in accordance with the following policy.

* https://docs.openstack.org/python-novaclient/latest/contributor/deprecation-policy.html

The API bindings related to the APIs remains as they are
because python-openstackclient depends on the API bindings.

Change-Id: I89d7877e23e8802fe77987a7b24ea247e08d5218
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2020-12-26 18:52:56.000000000', 'message': '[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein EM

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I3c4ad43a9e878ac4d749f8a96c36a3da24d121e9

Actually, it is very specific case. It's only reveal in environment, where there is no pods. Therefore we could observe it on kuryr-kubernetes-tempest, but not on kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-containerized.
