Wow, this is probably the funniest problem I saw in a while! So apparently enabling that feature gate actually makes it return `None` as `items` element:

   File "/opt/stack/tempest/.tox/tempest/lib/python3.8/site-packages/kubernetes/client/models/v1_network_policy_list.py", line 113, in items
     raise ValueError("Invalid value for `items`, must not be `None`")  # noqa: E501
 ValueError: Invalid value for `items`, must not be `None`

It seems like the Python K8s client isn't really happy about and we do use it in the kuryr-tempest-plugin. The way forward with that would probably be to check if newer version of Python K8s client is free of the problem, but there's none. We should probably try this v17.14.0a1 somehow then. :/ If it won't help we'll most likely need to work it around somehow in tempest.'}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2021-01-11 16:06:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Adapt selfLink calculation for any k8s objects.

Also, selfLink occurrences in unit tests has been removed (besides
those, which actually make sense), and documentation.

Implements: blueprint selflink
Change-Id: Ib0bcc9f5cb6c4cdc27c3393dcb3f665b21cb64ac

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-04 09:02:53.000000000', 'message': "Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I2c517401aa1ae464e6563800ecb0a459076655b3

commit_message:
Use py3 as the default runtime for tox

Moving on py3 as the default runtime for tox to avoid to update this at
each new cycle.

Wallaby support officially the following runtimes [1]:
- Python 3.6
- Python 3.8

During Victoria Python 3.7 was used as the default runtime [2] however this
version isn't longer officially supported.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/wallaby.html#python-runtimes-for-wallaby
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/victoria.html#python-runtimes-for-victoria

Change-Id: I2c517401aa1ae464e6563800ecb0a459076655b3

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: Ic7efdcf1e01d6a743aa2c652b552928a7337ec4b

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I48d0ffa403de91ad4b49c00718bbaa411947412e

commit_message:
[Tempest Plugins] Tag stein-last

Stein branch is in Extended Maintenance now[1]. All Tempest
plugins are branchless which means master version of Tempest
and its plugins is used to test the supported stable branches.

Once stable branch is moved to EM state then, Tempest and its
plugins compatible tag needs to be released so that we can
keep testing the EM stable branches with this tag once master
Tempest and its plugins are not compatible[2].

This tag will help for testing the stable/stein with single
compatible tag of Tempest and its plugins.

Tagging 'stein-last' as well as a new version also with same hash.
Documenting this new tag name here
- https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

More detail on compatible version policy for Tempest and its
plugins is here
- https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/tempest_and_plugins_compatible_version_policy.html

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/stein/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/stable_branch_support_policy.html

Change-Id: I20303de64ae1e1c0448583819ade37ba928f8f3b

[{'created': '2021-01-07 13:23:21.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Ic771f9dfa0ee59c05f986bdbf24255dda87cc977

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-11-12 10:20:49.000000000', 'message': '[NetApp] Fix CIFS promote back issue

This change fixes the NetApp promote back issue when using CIFS
protocol. When promoting a replica, the NetApp ONTAP driver
attempts to create a new CIFS share entity (an access point as
defined in [1]) for the new active replica. This behavior
causes a failure since the storage identifies that a current
backend CIFS share with the same name exists, considering
that the reffered replica was once the active one.

This issue is addressed by removing the related CIFS share
entity when the replica gets promoted.

[1] https://library.netapp.com/ecmdocs/ECMP1401220/html/GUID-1898D717-A510-4B3D-B2E3-CCDDD5BD0089.html

Closes-Bug: #1879368
Change-Id: Id9bdd5df0ff05ea08881dd2c83397f0a367d9945
(cherry picked from commit c3aed22f9454ca684af45c929be19b8593d55609)
(cherry picked from commit d2514735141bcf982e4bf043802591b3d017b526)
(cherry picked from commit 226f7e758a0b704e023e6aec0dfd271d9c4d3716)
(cherry picked from commit ef8d704c3b08d7de64926549a2f8f14cec3bfd0b)
'}]
commit_message:
[NetApp] Fix CIFS promote back issue

This change fixes the NetApp promote back issue when using CIFS
protocol. When promoting a replica, the NetApp ONTAP driver
attempts to create a new CIFS share entity (an access point as
defined in [1]) for the new active replica. This behavior
causes a failure since the storage identifies that a current
backend CIFS share with the same name exists, considering
that the reffered replica was once the active one.

This issue is addressed by removing the related CIFS share
entity when the replica gets promoted.

[1] https://library.netapp.com/ecmdocs/ECMP1401220/html/GUID-1898D717-A510-4B3D-B2E3-CCDDD5BD0089.html

Closes-Bug: #1879368
Change-Id: Id9bdd5df0ff05ea08881dd2c83397f0a367d9945
(cherry picked from commit c3aed22f9454ca684af45c929be19b8593d55609)
(cherry picked from commit d2514735141bcf982e4bf043802591b3d017b526)
(cherry picked from commit 226f7e758a0b704e023e6aec0dfd271d9c4d3716)
(cherry picked from commit ef8d704c3b08d7de64926549a2f8f14cec3bfd0b)

commit_message:
Allow to tag projects as "last" on EM branches

For testing for Extended Maintenance branches with branchless
Tempest and Tempest plugins, we need to release the new tag
for Tempest and its plugins as last compatible version for that
Extended Maintenance branches.

This commits adds the documentation and validation machinery changes about
that tag $series-last which will be used for branchless testing tooling.

Change-Id: I799e8e637a54a46fd7ca74dd568ea2c7506fa32d
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-team-guide/+/769821

commit_message:
Add support for kata container runtime

This adds support for kata containers by installing and configuring
the relevant runtime.

The default remains as 'runc' but can be adjusted using the
variable added to the defaults.

Change-Id: Iea07012d092333c656b397f97b541a2f0a5f0e44

commit_message:
Add a delay/retry is vmedia insert fails

If media had been ejected beforehand then an immediate
insert may fail.

Change-Id: I6cf7169f83356c248d4df61e1d9bba157c8499db
Story: #2008504
Task: #41572

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-12 11:45:06.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We divide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: I67a874a94e7ef5793f484599f92cd81f20f42df3
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce number of processes on small systems

Even the most modest 4C/8T system would run with the maximum 16 processes
due to the calculation being VCPU*2.

We divide amount of CPUs to number of threads for hyperthreaded CPUs

Change-Id: I67a874a94e7ef5793f484599f92cd81f20f42df3

[{'created': '2020-12-17 12:28:46.000000000', 'message': 'Fix aggregate functional test for id restriction

Nova just landed a change that validates aggregate ids are ints.
This had a side-effect of causing our aggregate test to fail,
because we were sending a delete by name not id. It was failing
open for us - the delete would have likely not done anything
before.

commit_message:
Fix aggregate functional test for id restriction

Nova just landed a change that validates aggregate ids are ints.
This had a side-effect of causing our aggregate test to fail,
because we were sending a delete by name not id. It was failing
open for us - the delete would have likely not done anything
before.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/os-client-config/+/770598
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/767287

Change-Id: I1e151454f39d51db52cdc7a23dbdcbf9b28c9381
(cherry picked from commit a0e68c318fff84303a78fd339e3fa7eec1e9b7b4)

commit_message:
Remove lower-constraints job

As discussed during the upstream ironic community meeting on
Monday Dec 14 2020, the lower-constraints job is being removed.

Also increasing memory for the grenade job.

Change-Id: I943b63b9c6a980011b35bb028c64bee18d772750
(cherry picked from commit c6fdf2511697305e2f00ec444081ab3353074b22)

[{'created': '2020-12-15 16:38:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix overcloud host image resolv workaround on CentOS 8.3

If a seed's bifrost_deploy container is deployed using a CentOS 8.2 base
image, prior to the CentOS 8.3 release, then a user runs 'kayobe seed
service deploy', the following task may fail:

    TASK [Ensure the overcloud host image has bogus name server entries removed]

This seems to be an issue with libgcrypt not being upgraded with
qemu-kvm, and becoming incompatible. The workaround is to ensure
libgcrypt is upgraded also.

Story: 2008430
Task: 41379

Change-Id: I82313fcd258e58969e0b68ae91a78943df537a7f

commit_message:
Fix overcloud host image resolv workaround on CentOS 8.3

If a seed's bifrost_deploy container is deployed using a CentOS 8.2 base
image, prior to the CentOS 8.3 release, then a user runs 'kayobe seed
service deploy', the following task may fail:

    TASK [Ensure the overcloud host image has bogus name server entries removed]

This seems to be an issue with libgcrypt not being upgraded with
qemu-kvm, and becoming incompatible. The workaround is to ensure
libgcrypt is upgraded also.

Story: 2008430
Task: 41379

Change-Id: I82313fcd258e58969e0b68ae91a78943df537a7f

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
-https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
This allows to use lower-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I2dcd646a65812b8951881376086533197e97f0f8

commit_message:
Fix the unit test tree structure

There were a few unit test files that didn't match their
code counterparts, so were a little hard to find. Moved
things around to line-up better, leaving only a handful
of exceptions to ignore. Added a test script to check
things so it won't happen again, copied from Neutron.

No actual code was changed, files were just moved around.

Change-Id: I6d84047b3481a2bf6bf9bd17d482fb504dbc752b

commit_message:
Microversion 2.88: Replace tenant* with project* in flavor-access commands

This patch replaces 'tenant*' with 'project*' in below apis, and it will
add ``add_project_access (addProjectAccess action)`` and
``remove_project_access (removeProjectAccess action)`` method in
flavor_access.py.

- ``nova flavor-access-add``
- ``nova flavor-access-remove``

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: Iacc7b00a7f9a1520436508d8b97429c5b1967e30

subject: Replace tenant with project in nova CLI
messages:
[{'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2021-01-03 02:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-01-03 04:31:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

IMO, the '--all-tenants' CLI option should be deprecated with warnings in 2.88 or later for a while (six months).
Then remove (cap) the '--all-tenants' CLI option."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2021-01-03 04:40:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> (1 comment)
> 
> IMO, the '--all-tenants' CLI option should be deprecated with warnings in 2.88 or later for a while (six months).
> Then remove (cap) the '--all-tenants' CLI option.

No, I am not deprecated it, just add the micorversion limit.
And after we merged remove --all-tenants in Nova apis, we should remind users this will be decrepated in microversion 2.87, and they can use --all-projects since v2.88.

So I think it's suitable to change with this way."}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2021-01-03 07:18:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-01-03 10:47:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> > IMO, the '--all-tenants' CLI option should be deprecated with warnings in 2.88 or later for a while (six months).
> > Then remove (cap) the '--all-tenants' CLI option.
> 
> No, I am not deprecated it, just add the micorversion limit.
> And after we merged remove --all-tenants in Nova apis, we should remind users this will be decrepated in microversion 2.87, and they can use --all-projects since v2.88.
> 
> So I think it's suitable to change with this way.

I would like to know other cores' opinions."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2021-01-03 15:04:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-01-03 15:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2021-01-05 01:03:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2021-01-15 14:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Microversion 2.88 support (Drop statistics-style fields from os-hypervisors) has been merged.

* https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764040

So this patch should be updated. (2.89 or later)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2021-01-18 15:12:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

This didn't win the race for 2.88 and needs to be reworked as a result.

I'm also tempted to agree with Takashi-san. Would it not better to accept '--all-tenants' and '--all-projects' regardless of the requested microversion? We could deprecate the former, but they're synonyms for each other so I don't see any reason one couldn't request '--all-projects' on e.g. microversion 2.46 and we would simply translate this under the hood."}]

commit_message:
Replace tenant with project in nova CLI

This patch supports microversion 2.88, it will replace 'tenant_id' with
'project_id', and replace 'all_tenants' with 'all_projects' in below commands:

- ``nova list``
- ``nova start``
- ``nova stop``
- ``nova delete``
- ``nova reset-state``

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: Ife5c2d205370fcbda7186eca3f1650cc55026b44

commit_message:
Increase swap size in order to avoid OOM killer

stopping check jobs.

Also switch ussuri jobs to non-voting until HEAT has merged replacing
Fedora 31 with the Fedora 32 image.

Change-Id: Ifc5a6c442ec68438dbe58e2c84e1861c43d6fad4

commit_message:
Updates for testing period for 20.01 release

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* rebuild for reactive charms
* ensure tox.ini is from release-tools
* ensure requirements.txt files are from release-tools
* On reactive charms:
  - ensure master branch for charms.openstack
  - ensure master branch for charm-helpers

Change-Id: Ie0f91b9d2a343fb67e0a3137b1a0ac7be1d245ae

messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-07 15:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-11 14:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28062, 'date': '2021-01-18 14:05:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 15:44:53.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iac7d5ec69724206453c5fc74cbd61efde9b9a1ee

Change-Id: Iac7d5ec69724206453c5fc74cbd61efde9b9a1ee

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iac7d5ec69724206453c5fc74cbd61efde9b9a1ee

The memory usage of xz varies from a few hundred kilobytes to
several gigabytes depending on the compression settings.

This should help preventing something getting OOM-killed

Change-Id: Iee661d3ff0411affed5c370f0ecbd3f10db0446d

commit_message:
Limit memory usage for xz

The memory usage of xz varies from a few hundred kilobytes to
several gigabytes depending on the compression settings.

This should help preventing something getting OOM-killed
in during uploading logs.

Change-Id: Iee661d3ff0411affed5c370f0ecbd3f10db0446d

[{'created': '2020-12-18 15:13:19.000000000', 'message': '[GRE] Add possibility to create GRE tunnels over IPv6

In case when IPv6 addresses are used for GRE tunnels, tunnel
type set for the openvswitch interface should be "ip6gre" instead of
"gre" which was set so far.
This patch changes that so now Neutron configures correct GRE tunnel
types.

Change-Id: I557af0bcafac4583ad9726c9bf707cf1fb92ffc5
Closes-Bug: #1904564
(cherry picked from commit 80e6781bc2d2b39e547e80996743d29ec090c816)
'}]
commit_message:
[GRE] Add possibility to create GRE tunnels over IPv6

In case when IPv6 addresses are used for GRE tunnels, tunnel
type set for the openvswitch interface should be "ip6gre" instead of
"gre" which was set so far.
This patch changes that so now Neutron configures correct GRE tunnel
types.

Change-Id: I557af0bcafac4583ad9726c9bf707cf1fb92ffc5
Closes-Bug: #1904564
(cherry picked from commit 80e6781bc2d2b39e547e80996743d29ec090c816)

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I4bbbd504e7be70e1a02b308c5e7b2a761e9d124f

can this be put on hold/WF-1 until I test this with iDRAC? I plan to do it this week.'}, {'account_id': 27909, 'date': '2021-01-07 10:21:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(3 comments)

Good news everyone, iDRAC is still working with these changes.

I still have some comments to make the implementation clearer for now and future developers.

First, more unit test cases should be added to fill in the coverage gaps that this code has created and also to document the issue these changes are fixing. For example, there are no unit test updates for updateservice.py changes. I'd see that a new test case can be added that mimic iLO behavior. Current JSON examples used in unit tests also don't depict scenario where URL joining produces meaningful URL.

Second, is there any value introducing task_uri in TaskMonitor constructor? In the end in ironic it gets assigned to task_monitor anyway. See [1], [2] and [3]. Why not assign to task_monitor at the very beginning in updateservice.py? Otherwise I'm missing why this "roundtrip" is necessary, but unit test cases should clarify need for this if there is any.

I have left some inline comments to add more details.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/764914/5/ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/management.py#749
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic/+/764914/5/ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/management.py#956
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/sushy/+/764915/5/sushy/resources/updateservice/updateservice.py#176'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2021-01-12 07:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 19604, 'date': '2021-01-12 08:10:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Fixes issue of redfish firmware update

This patch fixes issue of redfish firmware update
for ilo5 based hardware by adding a new attribute
task_uri to monitor and validate the firmware
update since task_monitor uri does not provide the
appropriate response.

Change-Id: Ida1d314f77b9f114e572639c7ad46545be1ce962
Story: #2008403
Task: #41339

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-07 13:06:59.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Ic1504a18a780b0f517c5aa3dd3bfb04998d42e74
"}, {'created': '2021-01-18 09:57:05.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

Bump a series of lower-constraints and requirements to work with new pip
resolver, testing with steps outlined at [5]

Fix Flake8 E741 [6]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html

"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

/!\/!\/!\
Notice that I voluntarily added the doc directory even if no docs
are generated here because zuul will try to pull this requirements from
there first and the contained requirements are needed for reno but AFAIK
the releasenotes dir is ignored by zuul. c.f [4] for further details.
/!\/!\/!\

Bump a series of lower-constraints and requirements to work with new pip
resolver, testing with steps outlined at [5]

Fix Flake8 E741 [6]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36
[5] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019285.html
[6] https://www.flake8rules.com/rules/E741.html

Change-Id: Ic1504a18a780b0f517c5aa3dd3bfb04998d42e74

commit_message:
Document $series-last tag for Temepst to test EM branches

For testing for Extended Maintenance branches with branchless
Tempest and Tempest plugins, we need to release the new tag
for Tempest and its plugins as last compatible version for that
Extended Maintenance branches.

This commits adds the documentation about that tag $series-last
which will be used for branchless testing tooling.

Change-Id: I213112b9f03b79311c5e54200ed1cca0c8b817c3

Move shares filtering to database layer

the queries performance improved.

commit_message:
Align lower-constraints for new pip

- Bump a series of lower-constraints and requirements to work with new pip
resolver, testing with steps outlined at [1]

- Fix Flake8 E741 [2]

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019285.html
[2] https://www.flake8rules.com/rules/E741.html

Change-Id: Idb0747ca0a72d10e129585fb9691817da9194553

commit_message:
Remove useless email section

During milestone-2 we automatically propose to release each project
that haven't yet been released previously [1] so I think this section
of the email is useless.

This patch allow us to discuss about this.

[1] https://releases.openstack.org/reference/process.html#milestone-2

Change-Id: I0f55cada96e971c948f17333c3d4f19bcf5cc4eb

commit_message:
Updates for testing period for 20.01 release

Includes updates to charmhelpers/charms.openstack for cert_utils
and unit-get for the install hook error on Juju 2.9

* charm-helpers sync for classic charms
* rebuild for reactive charms
* ensure tox.ini is from release-tools
* ensure requirements.txt files are from release-tools
* On reactive charms:
  - ensure master branch for charms.openstack
  - ensure master branch for charm-helpers

Change-Id: I237735ac0c942bc5ddccf543541a43c8b44610be

commit_message:
Improve security service update

This patch adds a new manila specification to improve security
service update operation. Its extend the current udpate operation
to also apply the new configuration in all associated share servers

Change-Id: I158d0dda5591c36b1b62297f2cb63211c96c997a
Signed-off-by: Douglas Viroel <viroel@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow to provide different stdout callback to the libs

This patch depends on the callback modifcation which
allow to give other custom or default/standard callback
for the stdout from the user.

With the current situation, when passing another callback
than validation_json it breaks the VF logging.
We need to separate logging and stdout.

Change-Id: I1566d9763212f9538fea1c0885208db6b949023f

commit_message:
Fix redfish-virtual-media boot mode handling ordering

Currently sync_boot_mode does not happen for nodes with local boot
because of an early return. This patches fixes it.

Conflicts:
	ironic/drivers/modules/redfish/boot.py
	ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/redfish/test_boot.py

Change-Id: I37b91f93f8f1ca41b814199ec1c5733611b28299
(cherry picked from commit ad044d9e0b796fe0b8caab8370a8d040b64e506a)

subject: Reimplement "Drop --layers from buildah"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8833, 'name': 'Rabi Mishra', 'email': 'ramishra@redhat.com', 'username': 'rabi'}, {'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-12 18:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-12 18:02:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

let's see how it goes with a few rechecks"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-11-12 23:23:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Doesn't look like it saves time.
https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_e62/762561/1/check/tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8/e621705/job-output.txt
2020-11-12 20:05:44.891116 | TASK [build-containers : Run image build as ansible user > /home/zuul/workspace/build.log]
2020-11-12 20:36:24.390268 | primary | ok: Runtime: 0:30:38.402444

vs the revert patch

https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_b36/761996/1/check/tripleo-build-containers-ubi-8/b364a30/job-output.txt
2020-11-10 01:33:15.162933 | TASK [build-containers : Run image build as ansible user > /home/zuul/workspace/build.log]
2020-11-10 01:58:09.258823 | primary | ok: Runtime: 0:24:53.062323"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-13 16:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-13 16:52:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

let's see again with profiling details added. Then compare results for this top patch to that one to the bottom"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-17 10:07:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-17 10:22:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2 Workflow-1

So as my testing with https://github.com/containers/buildah/issues/2782 shows, that --layers option is only useful when building *exactly the same* containers but using different target directories. Which sounds bit pointless to me...

When building consequent containers that share some common base, the --layers buys nothing. Unsure if that's a bug or not, but here is nothing to fix anymore since we dropped --layers from our builds"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-18 12:53:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-18 12:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-18 13:05:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

I have great news the --layers option works for my local testing (with latest buildah built from trunk though)!

$ sudo buildah --log-level=debug bud --volume /etc/yum.repos.d:/etc/distro.repos.d:z --volume /etc/pki/rpm-gpg:/etc/pki/rpm-gpg:z --volume /etc/yum/pluginconf.d:/etc/yum/pluginconf.d:z --log-rusage --loglevel=3 --format docker --tls-verify=False --logfile /var/tmp/container-builds/c713ad7b-a9bd-4ee7-8f5a-30f25387e09d/base/collectd/collectd-build.log -t localhost:8787/tripleomaster/openstack-collectd:test /var/tmp/container-builds/c713ad7b-a9bd-4ee7-8f5a-30f25387e09d/base/collectd

and the log contains "Using cache ..." and completes much faster than executed without --layers.

So we need this patch, even if it will start working only later, with updated buildah'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-18 13:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

we can also wait and see to compare how it works with the buildah version used in CI'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-18 13:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

also note that retrying builds gives the --layers flag the full speed, since there is already a lot of layers in place and consequent retries will use that cache then.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-19 08:04:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-20 10:25:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

This should wait for a newer buildah version with the layers caching fixed. My local testing with latest buildah shows there *is* use of cache when building images ('Using cache <foo>'). While this version we have in CI shows nothing yet."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-23 10:32:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-23 10:34:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I see no harm in adding this --layers back. Even if the currently used buildah effectively noops out that mode because of missing fixes, the later versions will pick it and start using it.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-25 08:20:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-26 10:56:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-11-30 09:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2021-01-18 09:52:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Reimplement "Drop --layers from buildah"

Instead of dropping it, add  --rm false [0]

[0] https://github.com/containers/buildah/blob/5368ec3211027089489133e1393b5db7bb99f68a/pkg/cli/common.go#L206

Closes-bug: #1901753

subject: Reclaim shards when root container is reclaimed
messages:
[{'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-13 04:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-13 04:48:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

The probetest fails. And is suppose to as it is checking the current failure scenario. Once I add a fix the patch it should start passing :)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-13 06:36:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I have some code that will attempt to solve this issue via what's mentioned in the bug. It isn't too bad. Just need to write some tests to make sure it does what it's suppose to do. Hopefully push a second patchset tonight or tomorrow."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-01-13 15:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Love that you got this test going first!'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-14 06:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-14 06:48:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Still a WIP, just getting stuff off my computer. 

Been interesting. So even when a root is marked as deleted the internal client is returning as 200, so am currently using the put and delete timestamps to add the root delete timestamp.

the shards will insert the root delete timestamp to the sharding sysmeata. If the root container pops back (and put > delete ts) then the ts metadata will be removed.

Once the root ts reaches reclaim_age this will trigger the sharder to delete the shard, using the root ts as the timestamp, so it should get reclaimed close to the time of a root.

If a shard doesn't have the root TS but the root is gone then a root delete ts will be given as time.time(), so stragglers will get cleaned up later.

I've reworked the probe test. it isn't all working yet, many debugging the root gone scenario."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-14 06:58:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(6 comments)

Just some extra notes, things are aren't quite done or there are issues.

Also obvously I still have unit tests to write. I think I've spent too much time trying to get real reaping working :P"}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2021-01-14 16:40:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

I think this is coming along; it's tricky"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-14 22:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-15 01:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-15 01:23:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Almost there. the probe test is working again in my saio. And does a better job of testing.
 - Delete root
 - Run sharder on one shard and see that it gets the correct Root-Delete-Timestamp meta.
 - Reclaim the root (os.unlink)
 - run the sharder on the other shard that doesn't have the metadata to simulate one who comes later.
 - It gets a time.time() Root-Delete-Timestamp.

Also needed to add clear memcache as that's why I was having so much problems in the end. Turns out in the sharder we use X-Backend-Override-Deleted, so we'll always get a 200 response until the root is reclaimed when asking for shards."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-15 01:30:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-15 06:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-15 06:13:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(3 comments)

OK we know have some unit testing too. So will open this up for more reviews (no wip).

Some comments inline, would love to hear your thoughts.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2021-01-15 15:00:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)

Nice.

Did you think about the option of not allowing the root db to be deleted while there were active shards? I guess your solution does eventually get towards nothing on disk.

I didn't get time to play with the probe test yet."}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2021-01-18 08:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}]

'}, {'created': '2021-01-15 01:12:48.000000000', 'message': "Reclaim shards when root container is reclaimed

Currently when a root container is deleted and eventually reclaimed
any shards still out there with zero objects wont get deleted.

When we get auto sharding enabled, or more importantly shrinking these
shards should collapse into the root container. But there are edge cases
where these shards could still exist.

This patch fixes this issue by adding a new peice I shard sysmeta into a
shard, Root-Delete-Timestamp, if fetching shard ranges fails because the
root container is deleted.
If the root comes back then the metadata is removed. This gives the
shards a poison pill to clean up after reclaim age if the shards don't
get a chance to clean themselves up.

When a root container is marked as deleted the sharder will use the
returned X-Backend-Delete-Timestamp and X-Backend-Put-Timestamp
timestamps to determine the root's is deleted and what it's delete
timestamp is.
Once the root is reaped and if a shard hasn't got the
Root-Delete-Timestamp metadata set then the
X-Backend-[Put,Delete]-Timestamp headers will be zeroed, so we just use
the current time as a timestamp. This way orphaned shards will also be
cleaned up eventually.

Closes-Bug: #1911232

commit_message:
Reclaim shards when root container is reclaimed

Currently when a root container is deleted and eventually reclaimed
any shards still out there with zero objects wont get deleted.

When we get auto sharding enabled, or more importantly shrinking these
shards should collapse into the root container. But there are edge cases
where these shards could still exist.

This patch fixes this issue by adding a new peice I shard sysmeta into a
shard, Root-Delete-Timestamp, if fetching shard ranges fails because the
root container is deleted.
If the root comes back then the metadata is removed. This gives the
shards a poison pill to clean up after reclaim age if the shards don't
get a chance to clean themselves up.

When a root container is marked as deleted the sharder will use the
returned X-Backend-Delete-Timestamp and X-Backend-Put-Timestamp
timestamps to determine the root's is deleted and what it's delete
timestamp is.
Once the root is reaped and if a shard hasn't got the
Root-Delete-Timestamp metadata set then the
X-Backend-[Put,Delete]-Timestamp headers will be zeroed, so we just use
the current time as a timestamp. This way orphaned shards will also be
cleaned up eventually.

Closes-Bug: #1911232
Change-Id: Id734564601433c867d0a69e8121dd91105a2bcd3

[{'created': '2021-01-07 12:18:56.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I582c7b1b8008e72f376a24a58ca1ee5ac4d933bb
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].

Removing specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: I582c7b1b8008e72f376a24a58ca1ee5ac4d933bb

commit_message:
Actually fail if a stop or remove call fails

As part of the container rename actions, attempt to stop and remove
containers without actually checking if they exist. Additionally we
don't actually fail if these command fail which leads to other errors
later that may be unrelated to the core issue. This change adds
additional checks around the stop and remove container actions to ensure
that the container is running before stopping and exists before
removing.

Backport note:
This change includes the subsequent change[1] to fix the wrong method
name used.

[1] Ie0462cd89f0beb2a2adc82768dea7d42dc343192

Change-Id: I82172f5a2d4683509c802c0f14d571a40e21e6cc
Closes-Bug: #1907833
(cherry picked from commit 523465fe8cd845186e6b3095f6fd35fcc9712ace)

[{'created': '2021-01-07 13:24:53.000000000', 'message': 'Reproduce bug 1907522 in functional test

Cross cell resize does not support neutron ports with resource request
as nova fails to send a proper port binding to neutron. This causes the
migration to fail. However we should simply not allow the migration to
go cross cell if the server has such ports.

This patch adds a functional test to reproduce the problem

Change-Id: Id91d2e817ef6bd21124bb840bdb098054e9753b8
Related-Bug: #1907522
(cherry picked from commit f96ade2726c4ff91690064e9ae228fa12e618540)
'}, {'created': '2021-01-11 15:23:19.000000000', 'message': 'Reproduce bug 1907522 in functional test

Cross cell resize does not support neutron ports with resource request
as nova fails to send a proper port binding to neutron. This causes the
migration to fail. However we should simply not allow the migration to
go cross cell if the server has such ports.

This patch adds a functional test to reproduce the problem

On the stable branches Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 was
never done and therefore bug 1907511 visible first during the
reproduction (this bug does not exists on master due to the above
linked change). But if 1907511 has fixed then 1907522 would be visible.
Our incoming bugfix solves fixes both bug at the same time. This means
that the backport is not clean, the reproduction test changed to assert
bug 1907511 instead of bug 1907522

Change-Id: Id91d2e817ef6bd21124bb840bdb098054e9753b8
Related-Bug: #1907522
Related-Bug: #1907511
(cherry picked from commit f96ade2726c4ff91690064e9ae228fa12e618540)
'}]
commit_message:
Reproduce bug 1907522 in functional test

Cross cell resize does not support neutron ports with resource request
as nova fails to send a proper port binding to neutron. This causes the
migration to fail. However we should simply not allow the migration to
go cross cell if the server has such ports.

This patch adds a functional test to reproduce the problem

On the stable branches Ie15ec8299ae52ae8f5334d591ed3944e9585cf71 was
never done and therefore bug 1907511 visible first during the
reproduction (this bug does not exists on master due to the above
linked change). But if 1907511 has fixed then 1907522 would be visible.
Our incoming bugfix solves fixes both bug at the same time. This means
that the backport is not clean, the reproduction test changed to assert
bug 1907511 instead of bug 1907522

Change-Id: Id91d2e817ef6bd21124bb840bdb098054e9753b8
Related-Bug: #1907522
Related-Bug: #1907511
(cherry picked from commit f96ade2726c4ff91690064e9ae228fa12e618540)

We use maintenance mode to signal that hardware needs additional
intervention, because of potential damage or stuck long-running

commit_message:
Do not enter maintenance if cleaning fails before running the 1st step

We use maintenance mode to signal that hardware needs additional
intervention, because of potential damage or stuck long-running
processes. This is not the case for PXE booting or invalid requested
manual clean steps, so don't set maintenance if no clean step is
running when the failure occurs.

Change-Id: I8a7ce072359660fc6640e5f20ec2d3c452033557
(cherry picked from commit ad696c9bac379a690b1f674de4983bf1a06a243e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-17 08:40:22.000000000', 'message': 'allow create-repo-list to be run without six

Some distros (gentoo) do not come with six in the base image (stage3),
it is installed later in the image build.  Use the native
urlopen/URLError if the six version is not available.

Change-Id: Id1c52aa17e565c16369645508e43e4f485defa66
'}]
commit_message:
allow create-repo-list to be run without six

Some distros (gentoo) do not come with six in the base image (stage3),
it is installed later in the image build.  Use the native
urlopen/URLError if the six version is not available.

Change-Id: Id1c52aa17e565c16369645508e43e4f485defa66

commit_message:
Modify PciDevice.uuid generation code

Use the same pattern used in nova.objects.BlockDeviceMapping, allowing
us to share code with that object and paving the way for a future online
migration script.

Change-Id: I47a27c17ec789a96e33c2e5ff8dd8b09ac74f600

commit_message:
Add WaitForPortCreateEvent in BaseOVSTestCase

When a port is created, the test case will wait until the IDL event
is raised and the port is effectively created and the local DB
cache is updated.

Change-Id: I660baccde67a040731538276fc6dff05a10efb68
Related-Bug: #1910717
(cherry picked from commit e0f15c59828bc95c7de56475f036b8867f85d3f6)

subject: create or delete port forwarding, update the floating ip status

commit_message:
create or delete port forwarding, update the floating ip status

create port forwarding, should set floating ip status running, delete all port
forwarding, the floating ip status should be down.

Closes-Bug: #1910334

Change-Id: I8b3e4bf6b3cac3a95ea76b85dd4882ddafc962c8

commit_message:
Optimize get_ports with trunk extension

Use case: many trunk ports (300+) each with many subports.
Issue: get_ports takes much time.
Solution: apply trunk resource extend func for a full list of ports,
not for each port individually, thus avoiding a DB query for each
trunk port.

The approach will be extended for other resource extenders, like QoS,
and probably for other resources as well.
QoS: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/764454

Change-Id: Ic08e4049f6156c0700ca3c7aee251b6eb0eb97da
Closes-Bug: #1905268

commit_message:
Pure Storage FlashArray: Add active/active support

This patch enables the `SUPPORTS_ACTIVE_ACTIVE` flag in the driver,
to allow configuring Pure Storage backends when the volume service
is clustered.

Change-Id: I53ab2c8dae43d5aef7a65d35ad99e55f0acb7431

commit_message:
Move daxio package to be arch specific

daxio package isn't available on non-x86_64 so we are moving this
under x86_64 arch following nova-libvirt.yaml example.

Change-Id: I60c0e2fae1f5a4ad4f884b88e22ce4fdcabd5cdf
(cherry picked from commit 64d4af476bb7a70fa11ef4004f696b311ffef008)
(cherry picked from commit 07b7c152dc211c32a781df768dc561879f4eba70)

subject: Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-12-24 06:17:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ia38b20ae078b29fc1af68c10f085ec8eb81699c4
'}]
commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

Change-Id: Ia38b20ae078b29fc1af68c10f085ec8eb81699c4

commit_message:
Wire up new tripleo upgrades jobs template

The depends-on adds a new upgrade jobs template which is wired up
here. Once wired up across tripleo we can remove excess content
providers with [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ci/+/769131
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/761188

Change-Id: Ibd67de5d23d9c6437a6e95d0c413c2bf19e83a65

commit_message:
Disable dns-integration API extension if it's not enabled in ML2

In case when dns-integration ML2 extension driver isn't enabled,
ovn_l 3 service plugin will now not load "dns-integration"
API extension to list it as supported.

This patch also adds method supported_extension_aliases() which was
originally introduced in patch [1] but it can't be backported.

Conflicts:
    neutron/services/ovn_l3/plugin.py

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/722415

Closes-bug: #1906311
Change-Id: I6a7ff14057d80196feb5fd9d47a6a73b29bc768d
(cherry picked from commit e70e3ab4558a2e7c448bac475041d436d7348816)

subject: horizon: set FORCE_GENERATE to no if not set
messages:
[{'account_id': 167, 'date': '2020-11-30 12:48:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2020-12-14 10:28:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is it needed? script later checks only for 'yes'"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-12-18 20:01:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

When are you hitting this? I assume you are running this outside of K-A which always sets this to either `yes` or `no`.
I know the Horizon is now a pain the butt that we enabled failing on undefined vars (exactly why we had to hold the K-A changes dropping Searchlight and Qinling until the Kolla changes got published to DockerHub).'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-06 09:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Needs more info'}, {'account_id': 167, 'date': '2021-01-14 08:11:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1
> 
> Needs more info

I think it makes sense to have default values for variables. The default in kolla-ansible is no: ansible/roles/horizon/defaults/main.yml:      FORCE_GENERATE: "{{ 'yes' if horizon_dev_mode | bool else 'no' }}". Because of that I set no here as well.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-14 09:28:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> Patch Set 1:

Ok. I think we were just wondering if there is a bug that's being fixed.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2021-01-14 09:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Lets use set's discard() method instead of remove() to not raise
an exception when port forwarding or FIP is removed from port forwarding cache,
and FIP is not in cache actually.

Change-Id: Idf91002dc8ad4b16218c6a332a93c744218be73a
Related-Bug: #1896735
(cherry picked from commit e392fb68c508e9bcd1390245879a28d34b1fa381)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't fail if FIP is not in port forwarding cache during cleaning

Lets use set's discard() method instead of remove() to not raise
an exception when port forwarding or FIP is removed from port forwarding cache,
and FIP is not in cache actually.

Change-Id: Idf91002dc8ad4b16218c6a332a93c744218be73a
Related-Bug: #1896735
(cherry picked from commit e392fb68c508e9bcd1390245879a28d34b1fa381)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-15 18:38:40.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lowwer-constraints

bandit 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the
release is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to
1.6.2 when using py2.

With the new pip dependency resolver (introduced in pip 20.3) the
lower-constraints job started to fail. Problem is here with the
'install_command' in tox.ini, which uses both the upper- and lower-
constraints files, causing the job to fail. This patch adds separate
install_command without the upper constraints, so that only the
lower-constraints.txt is used.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: If8738f5005e60cf46ed93edbefa272bc2611b53f
"}, {'created': '2021-01-15 22:06:13.000000000', 'message': "[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lowwer-constraints

release is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to
1.6.2 when using py2.

With the new pip dependency resolver (introduced in pip 20.3) the
lower-constraints job started to fail. Problem is here with the
'install_command' in tox.ini, which uses both the upper- and lower-
constraints files, causing the job to fail. This patch adds separate
install_command without the upper constraints, so that only the
lower-constraints.txt is used.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: If8738f5005e60cf46ed93edbefa272bc2611b53f
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lowwer-constraints

bandit 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the
release is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to
1.6.2 when using py2.

With the new pip dependency resolver (introduced in pip 20.3) the
lower-constraints job started to fail. Problem is here with the
'install_command' in tox.ini, which uses both the upper- and lower-
constraints files, causing the job to fail. This patch adds separate
install_command without the upper constraints, so that only the
lower-constraints.txt is used.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: If8738f5005e60cf46ed93edbefa272bc2611b53f

subject: proxy: stop sending frags to PyECLib with a Queue
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 597, 'name': 'Pete Zaitcev', 'email': 'zaitcev@kotori.zaitcev.us', 'username': 'zaitcev'}, {'_account_id': 1179, 'name': 'Clay Gerrard', 'email': 'clay.gerrard@gmail.com', 'username': 'clay-gerrard'}, {'_account_id': 9625, 'name': 'Thiago da Silva', 'email': 'thiagodasilva@gmail.com', 'username': 'thiago'}, {'_account_id': 13852, 'name': 'Romain LE DISEZ', 'email': 'romain.le-disez@corp.ovh.com', 'username': 'rledisez'}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-01-29 21:47:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-03-11 05:12:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I'm having a serious problem verifying this on py27. A full run of the unit tests fails, but if I re-run individual tests then everything works. It's quite vexing."}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-08 19:58:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-08 20:01:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

A very little update on this patch:
1/ it removes a useless sleep() that was really killing performance
2/ it increase the size of the test object in one test because now the proxy can send everything to the TCP buffer so it might not get that the client is disconnected if the object is smaller than the TCP buffer
3/ It disables the test that is creating the random test failure

I don't know why this test create a random behavior"}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-08 21:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

To reproduce the issue, you have to run all proxy tests:
  nosetests test/unit/proxy/

With the test_GET_with_frags_swapped_around disable it pass, while if the test is enable, we get some random failures'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2020-04-09 14:43:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I couldn't get this test to fail on my machine when running it like:

while true; do nosetests swift/test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py:TestECObjController.test_GET_with_frags_swapped_around; if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then break; fi; done

remove the double und so we can let it fail in the gate

If we can find the race and widen it with some sleep it should be possible to fix it"}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-15 21:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2020-04-15 21:37:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I couldn't get this test to fail on my machine when running it
 > like:

This test is not broken. It breaks other (random) tests in proxy/test_server.py.

Command:
while :; do nosetests test/unit/proxy/ &>/dev/null && echo -n . || echo -n x; done

With test_GET_with_frags_swapped_around disabled:
......^C


With test_GET_with_frags_swapped_around enabled:
xxxxx^C


I pushed the same code with the test enabled."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-08 17:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck

Just trying to remember what the error was.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-08 19:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-10-08 20:26:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Here's a bet: it will fail on py27."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-10-14 01:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Fails on py27 with
"ERROR: Package 'oslo.cache' requires a different Python: 2.7.17 not in '>=3.6'"
How are we pulling Oslo? Keystoneclient, I bet. Or maybe PBR?'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2020-10-14 04:05:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

recheck

Yeah, it's coming in because of keystone at least; probably barbican, too. I've seen a fair number of these sorts of errors lately; I think some of the test runners are (were?) hooked up to bad pypi mirrors."}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-19 04:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-19 14:36:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck

17 failures and 16 errors because of 60 seconds ChunkWriteTimeout. Starts with test_small_suffix_aligned and continues for a few tests along the lines of ranged GETs.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-20 03:14:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-20 04:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2020-11-23 21:58:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-01-16 02:35:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-01-16 02:37:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

No changes - only rebased. However! Tim added a double-run: tests that fail get re-executed by ID. With that, a possibility exists for this to pass.'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2021-01-16 16:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-29 21:47:22.000000000', 'message': 'proxy: stop sending frags to PyECLib with a Queue

As explained in commit 2f1111a4364858fe87696f748405e6a3ff8f5655, moving data
through a Queue is very CPU intensive. All fragments downloaded from
object-servers are sent to PyECLib using queues. This commit remove the
usage of queues.

Change-Id: I557acd547788b3259b5ae5b38a7be191235cf267
'}, {'created': '2020-04-08 19:58:56.000000000', 'message': 'proxy: stop sending frags to PyECLib with a Queue

As explained in commit 2f1111a4364858fe87696f748405e6a3ff8f5655, moving data
through a Queue is very CPU intensive. All fragments downloaded from
object-servers are sent to PyECLib using queues. This commit remove the
usage of queues during a GET request of object on erasure code policy.

The gain on bandwidth and CPU usage is significant. On a benchmark
environment, it gave this result for a download of a 6 GB object on an
erasure code 8+2 policy (average of 3 runs):
    master: 3.04 Gbps / 1693 jiffies consumed by the proxy-server
    this patch: 5.71 Gbps / 903 jiffies consumed by the proxy-server

Change-Id: I557acd547788b3259b5ae5b38a7be191235cf267

commit_message:
proxy: stop sending frags to PyECLib with a Queue

As explained in commit 2f1111a4364858fe87696f748405e6a3ff8f5655, moving
data through a Queue is very CPU intensive. All fragments downloaded from
object-servers are sent to PyECLib using queues. This commit remove the
usage of queues during a GET request of object on erasure code policy.

The gain on bandwidth and CPU usage is significant. On a benchmark
environment, it gave this result for a download of a 6 GB object on an
erasure code 8+2 policy (average of 3 runs):
    master: 3.04 Gbps / 1693 jiffies consumed by the proxy-server
    this patch: 5.71 Gbps / 903 jiffies consumed by the proxy-server

Change-Id: I557acd547788b3259b5ae5b38a7be191235cf267

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lower-constraints

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Contradicting hacking version replaced (in lower-constraints.txt to
match with test-requirements.txt).

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I2df0f9778b029ea369492649041ed375dccef2a7

commit_message:
Add lint dependencies for content provider

If linting fails, content provider still builds.
Whis is suboptimal, since standalone/multinode jobs will be skipped and
nothing will use those builds.

Put cprovider into dependency on the linting jobs as well.

Change-Id: Icdd2c581c8e610eb687042044c2a8f3efee44527
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Improve the CIDRs overlap check method for router add interface

If an external network have multiple subnets, the router whose
external gateway at the network will have all routes about those
subnets. So, when a internal subnet was added to the router, all
subnets of the the network which the router's external gateway
belong to need to be joined to check whether the CIDRs is
overlapped.

Also, this patch revert the patch [1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/473356/

Change-Id: Id5d8ac09a38c656619f88a6f87b8f384fe4c55a8
Closes-Bug: #1903433
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/763621
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/763626
(cherry picked from commit 8ebd54d1bcb6d4437cf9501f1c5993177747fac2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-15 16:32:13.000000000', 'message': "Un-pause Gentoo image builds

We haven't refreshed Gentoo images for the better part of a year,
and now the ones we're using are consistently failing jobs so we
need to update them. Un-pause initially to see if we can spot the
reason they fail (if they still fail).

Change-Id: I9bc26974f641eb934a85a730d0910cb170000e47
"}]
commit_message:
Un-pause Gentoo image builds

We haven't refreshed Gentoo images for the better part of a year,
and now the ones we're using are consistently failing jobs so we
need to update them. Un-pause initially to see if we can spot the
reason they fail (if they still fail).

Change-Id: I9bc26974f641eb934a85a730d0910cb170000e47

commit_message:
Change default num_retries for glance to 3

Previously, the default value of num_retries for glance is 0.
It means that the request to glance is sent only one time.
On the other hand, neutron and cinder clients set the default
value to 3.
To align the default value for retry to other components, we
should change the default value to 3.

Closes-Bug: #1888168
Change-Id: Ibbd4bd26408328b9e1a1128b3794721405631193
(cherry picked from commit 662af9fab6eacb46bcaee38d076d33c2c0f82b9b)
(cherry picked from commit 1f9dd694b937cc55a81a64fdce442829f009afb3)
(cherry picked from commit ca2fd8098a47cf2c38351dc4c8c65c7c5fe0afc3)

commit_message:
Improve the CIDRs overlap check method for router add interface

If an external network have multiple subnets, the router whose
external gateway at the network will have all routes about those
subnets. So, when a internal subnet was added to the router, all
subnets of the the network which the router's external gateway
belong to need to be joined to check whether the CIDRs is
overlapped.

Also, this patch revert the patch [1]
[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/473356/

Change-Id: Id5d8ac09a38c656619f88a6f87b8f384fe4c55a8
Closes-Bug: #1903433
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/763621
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/763626
(cherry picked from commit 8ebd54d1bcb6d4437cf9501f1c5993177747fac2)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/victoria

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/victoria.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/victoria.

Sem-Ver: feature

to test lower-constraints [1].

CI job [2].

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-20 10:47:16.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Cyborg shelve/unshelve support

This change extends the conductor manager to append the cyborg
resource request to the request spec when performing an unshelve.

On shelve offload an instance will be deleted the instance's ARQs
binding info to free up the bound ARQs in Cyborg service.
And this change passes the ARQs to spawn during unshelve an instance.

This change extends the ``shelve_offload_instance`` and
``unshelve_instance`` rpcapi function to carry the arq_uuids.
This eliminates the need to lookup the uuids associated with the arqs
assinged to the instance by quering Cyborg.

Implements: blueprint cyborg-shelve-and-unshelve
Change-Id: I258df4d77f6d86df1d867a8fe27360731c21d237
"}, {'created': '2020-05-22 09:00:08.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Cyborg shelve/unshelve support

This change extends the conductor manager to append the cyborg
resource request to the request spec when performing an unshelve.

On shelve offload an instance will be deleted the instance's ARQs
binding info to free up the bound ARQs in Cyborg service.
And this change passes the ARQs to spawn during unshelve an instance.

"}, {'created': '2020-07-02 00:54:17.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Cyborg shelve/unshelve support

"}, {'created': '2020-07-17 10:22:21.000000000', 'message': "Cyborg shelve/unshelve support

This change extends the conductor manager to append the cyborg
resource request to the request spec when performing an unshelve.

On shelve offload an instance will be deleted the instance's ARQs
binding info to free up the bound ARQs in Cyborg service.
And this change passes the ARQs to spawn during unshelve an instance.

This change extends the ``shelve_offload_instance`` and
``unshelve_instance`` rpcapi function to carry the arq_uuids.
This eliminates the need to lookup the uuids associated with the arqs
assinged to the instance by quering Cyborg.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Change-Id: I258df4d77f6d86df1d867a8fe27360731c21d237
"}, {'created': '2020-07-19 02:31:57.000000000', 'message': "Cyborg shelve/unshelve support

This change extends the conductor manager to append the cyborg
resource request to the request spec when performing an unshelve.

On shelve offload an instance will be deleted the instance's ARQs
binding info to free up the bound ARQs in Cyborg service.
And this change passes the ARQs to spawn during unshelve an instance.

This change extends the ``shelve_offload_instance`` and
``unshelve_instance`` rpcapi function to carry the arq_uuids.
This eliminates the need to lookup the uuids associated with the arqs
assinged to the instance by quering Cyborg.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Implements: blueprint cyborg-shelve-and-unshelve
Change-Id: I258df4d77f6d86df1d867a8fe27360731c21d237

commit_message:
Cyborg shelve/unshelve support

This change extends the conductor manager to append the cyborg
resource request to the request spec when performing an unshelve.

On shelve offload an instance will be deleted the instance's ARQs
binding info to free up the bound ARQs in Cyborg service.
And this change passes the ARQs to spawn during unshelve an instance.

This change extends the ``shelve_instance``, ``shelve_offload_instance``
and ``unshelve_instance`` rpcapi function to carry the arq_uuids.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

Implements: blueprint cyborg-shelve-and-unshelve
Change-Id: I258df4d77f6d86df1d867a8fe27360731c21d237

commit_message:
Dropping lower constraints testing (stable Train)

This topic was discussed on the ML and QA team proposed to
to test lower-constraints [1].

As decided in Neutron meeting, stable branches will drop this
CI job [2].

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-December/019390.html
[2]http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/networking/2021/networking.2021-01-12-14.00.log.html

Change-Id: Ibf9b20b993ab59b64bd4c954cfcd34f14e0e078c

are available in openvswitch are now passing all mandatory parameters

commit_message:
Fix calling of add_tunnel_port method from sanity checks module

Sanity checks functions which are checking if vxlan and geneve tunnels
are available in openvswitch are now passing all mandatory parameters
to the ovs_lib.OVSBridge.add_tunnel_port method.
Previously port_name was missing.

Closes-Bug: #1905568
Change-Id: Iae86705f1d30c89dc5482261d852b45787bd8782
(cherry picked from commit ab6c59b57e732def62e3817a80d081b8392d669a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-05 16:01:41.000000000', 'message': 'Check the revision number only once

When an OVO revision number transaction constraint is requested
in the HTTP header, the OVO standard attributes revision number
should be checked only once, because:
- The revision number constrain refers to a single resource; only
  a single check is needed.
- Some backends (OVN), execute more than one DB transaction.
  As reported in the related LP bug, the second time the OVO is
  checked during the second DB transaction, the revision number of
  the OVO has been bumped and does not match with the original
  number requested.

Closes-Bug: #1909008

Change-Id: I25c36b1604e5855a22960f1b504a79f740c134bb

'}, {'created': '2021-01-08 08:31:47.000000000', 'message': 'Check the revision number only once

should be checked only once, because:

  a single check is needed.
- Some backends (OVN), execute more than one DB transaction.

  the OVO has been bumped and does not match with the original

Change-Id: I25c36b1604e5855a22960f1b504a79f740c134bb
'}]
commit_message:
Check the revision number only once

When an OVO revision number transaction constraint is requested
in the HTTP header, the OVO standard attributes revision number
should be checked only once, because:
- The revision number constrain refers to a single resource; only
  a single check is needed.
- Some backends (OVN), execute more than one DB transaction.
  As reported in the related LP bug, the second time the OVO is
  checked during the second DB transaction, the revision number of
  the OVO has been bumped and does not match with the original
  number requested.

Closes-Bug: #1909008

Change-Id: I25c36b1604e5855a22960f1b504a79f740c134bb
